story:
About "Peter Pan"

Directed by Zach Kaufer
Stage Managed by Alice Pollitt
Choreography by Zach Kaufer and Leanna Dindal
Scenic Design by Victoria Tam
Costume Design by Brianna McDonnell
Lighting Design by Will Chandler
Sound Design by Emma Bramble
Technical Direction by Kate Harrow

November 1st, 2012 at 7:30pm
November 2nd, 2012 at 7:30pm and 11:00pm
November 3rd, 2012 at 2:30pm and 8:00pm
November 4th, 2012 at 2:30pm

Massman Theatre at USC
1029 Childs Way
Los Angeles, CA 90007

Compiled from the original texts of the classic story, John Caird and Trevor Nunn have created a retelling of the Peter Pan legend that “elevates the work from the basement of meaningless pantomime to a national treasure.” Much darker than the story we’re all used to, Peter Pan, or the Boy Who Would Not Grow Up begs the question: what happens when we grow up (or don’t)? Our production sets out to reimagine the classic story through the lens of a twenty-something artist working in London's East End as she searches through the stories of her ancestors for a direction to her own life. Our narrator seeks to discover what it means to reconnect with her roots and the magic of the boy who would not grow up.

What We Need

Funding for this project goes directly into our production budget which covers venue rental, production rights, costumes, scenic design, lighting design, sound design, and props. Every penny you contribute goes to making the Neverland the most magical place it can possibly be. If we don't reach our funding goal, our Neverland will still be magical, only without the full capacity to bring the audience into the story.

The Impact

This production of "Peter Pan" brought to the Los Angeles community will bring a new generation of artists closer to the story that inspires thousands every day. By updating and reimagining the work, we hope to bring a new relevance to force  our audiences to reconsider the ways in which they have chosen to grow up and to show those who might not have made it that far yet that there is a way to move through the transition between childhood and adulthood without losing that special spark of imagination. Your donation will also help subsidize the costs of bringing school children from local Los Angeles schools to the production free of cost.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are constantly in need of so much more than financial support. Due to the nature of our production, if you happen to have any old art supplies lying around, we'll take 'em! We are looking to create a working artist's studio in the theatre which requires a lot of "stuff".

story:
Who Are We?

The New Mercury Theatre Company – a community of actors serving the community - is a group of like-minded performers, actors and artists whose sole purpose is to produce monthly one-act plays, improv-sketch and stand-up comedy shows to benefit various charities in the New York/Tri-State area.

We are dedicated to donating every performance dollar we bring in, helping local charitable organizations.

New Mercury Theatre Company invites all entertainers dedicated to being of service to those in need to further this conversation - what is the responsibility in being an actor and artist in our city, our country, our planet?

 

Peter Spellos, Artistic Director

 

Jen Flanagan, Associate Artisitc Director

Shari Umansky, Producing Director

 

Chip Bolcik, Playwright-in-Residence

Patricia 'Iolana, Playwright Emeritus

 

Joe Charles, Social Media Director

Kirsty Sadler, Community Outreach Director

 

Opening Night…
Our inaugural theatrical venture raised $700 for the Brain and Behavior Research Foundation.  We performed four nights of one-act plays prior, to help pay for all of our producing costs (theatre rental, rehearsal space, etc.).  Pictures of these fun filled evenings can be seen on our website: www.nmtnyc.com as well as our Facebook fan page.

 

What We Need
Plain and simple…your help.  Our cadre of playwrights has gifted us with terrific one-act plays we plan on producing in the first half of 2013.  In order to do this, and give all proceeds to our selected charities, we need seed money to make our next five productions a reality. 

Your donations will allow us to give our hearts and every dollar we raise at the shows to charity.  Monies received from you, our family and friends of the New Mercury Theatre Company will go directly towards renting theatres for said shows, securing rehearsal space, purchasing props, costumes, scripts, and more.  Basically, with your help, we will not have to worry about raising funds.  We can just focus our talents and energies on helping those in need. 

Now, more than ever, the citizens and charities of the NYC/Tri-State area, having dealt with ravages of a terrible hurricane need our help.  We, in turn, need yours. 

 

Our Plan
Our plan is to produce once-a-month productions.  Sometimes they will be evenings of stand up comedy. Other times, our in house mirth makers, The Usual Suspects Improv/Sketch Troupe, will do the entertaining.  At least once-a-month we will do three evenings of one-act plays to be chosen from the following list, written by our playwrights.

(in no specific order)

Please Leave a Message by Jen Flanagan & Peter Spellos

The Worlds Worst Puppeteer by Chip Bolcik

The Man with No Shadowby Kitty Felde

G-Train Exodus  by Jessica Fleitman

Guardian Angel by Chip Bolcik

Kismet! - Not the Musical by Kerry Giese

Christmas Lotto by Chip Bolcik

The Tupperware Party by Brian Kirchner

Runaway by Brett Epstein

 

Your Impact / Our Opportunity

We strongly believe in the power of the creative arts and the strength and determination of our theatre company to make a difference in the community.  We want to serve those in need.  We want to put a smile on a face that may have not seen one in a long time.  We want to bring joy and entertainment to the lives of those less fortunate.  We see ourselves as the Long Ranger of the Theatre world.  We go to where we are needed.  We help out.  We ride off to the next adventure.    

We will achieve this by donating our time, talents, and ticket revenue to our fellow rangers in this lone world we all live in. 

With your help, we can produce these shows and benefit the community as much as possible.

 

More Ways You Can Help

First, donating to our cause via this campaign is the best way we can be the living embodiment of our mission statement.

We understand these are fiscally difficult time.  We get it.  Bur we are artists….so we really get it.  There are still more ways in which you and your friends can help us.

Here are some other ways you can lend a hand:

-       Send everyone to our website - www.nmtnyc.com

-       Like us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/NewMercuryTheatreCompany

-       Follow us on Twitter - @nmtnyc

-       Come see a live show of ours and bring all of your friends!

-       Call your grandma and ask her to dig the coffee cans out of the backyard

 

Thank you for caring about the arts.  Please support local theatre.  

Peter Spellos, Artistic Director

Jen Flanagan, Associate Artistic Director

-       Come see a live show of ours and bring all of your friends!
-       Call your grandma and ask her to dig the coffee cans out of the backyard
 
Thank you for caring about the arts.  Please support local theatre.  
Peter Spellos, Artistic Director
Jen Flanagan, Associate Artistic Director

story:
WINDYWOO AND HER

NAUGHTY NAUGHTY PETS

The Musical

created by

Wendy Ann Gardner 

is a new musical that will delight children of all ages!

Based on the popular children's animated series and books is coming to the NY stage!

Directed by

Jonathan Cerullo

Windywoo and her Naughty  Naughty Pets are devastated to learn the building, where they reside, is being sold to a big, big big big, New York real estate developer. Their beloved neighborhood is changing, and Hector, the building owner, wants them out! 

Will the power of pets move the human heart and save the day?

Against all odds, Windywoo keeps her family of pets together and learns that a home isn't as important as having someone to come home to.

Windywoo and Her Naughty Naughty Pets delivers a message of human kindness, love of pets, and the importance of families of all kinds. This delightful story will appeal to audiences of all ages, with real-world situations, infectious songs, and charming humor.

Please help us reach our goal to present a staged reading at

Amas Musical Theatre Dare to be Different Festival this coming November 23 & 24!

_________________________________

 

How is the funding being allocated?

ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

PLEASE EMAIL WINDYWOOMUSICAL@GMAIL.COM FOR MORE INFORMATION.

This reading has many moving parts and below is how your generously donated funds will be used:

  • 9 AEA Actors
  • 1 Stage Manager
  • 1 Production Assistant
  • SDC Director
  • Associate Director
  • Music Director
  • Musicians
  • Sound Operator & Rental
  • Insurance
  • Rehearsal Space 
  • Marketing- Info Pkg
  • Merchandising 
  • Box Office
  • Programs/Copying
  • Facebook Boosting
  • Producer
  • Contingency
  • Out Of Pocket Expenses - Staff

_________________________________

PLEASE VISIT US ON

WINDYWOO WEBSITE

INSTAGRAM

FACEBOOK

TWITTER

_________________________________

Meet Wendy!

                                                       

Wendy Ann Gardner (Book/Music/Lyrics) is a composer, lyricist, and author who lives in New York City. She wrote the book, music, and lyrics for an original musical titled Windywoo and Her Naughty Naughty Pets, which was presented in the 2015 New York Musical Theater Festival as a Developmental Reading, directed by award-winning Jonathan Cerullo, produced by Tony Award-winning producer Greg Nobile (Gentlemen’s Guide to Love and Murder, Sweeney Todd, Gypsy) and Seaview Productions.

Wendy was nominated for two Gemini Awards in 2006 and 2007 for her Animated TV show, The Naughty Naughty Pets, produced by CBC Canada and Decode Entertainment, which aired on Cartoon Network, CBC, BBC, NHK and has been translated into 7 languages and syndicated worldwide.

She also wrote a series of children's books about the Naughty Naughty Pets characters, published by Hyperion Books for Children in 2006. (an imprint of Disney)

She is the founder and creator of Scary Stories Inc., which licensed her unique graphics, commissioned by many companies, notably, Target, Nylabone, Paul Frank Industries, Mudpuppy, and Fiesta for use as logos, branding and character art. Her illustrations of the Naughty Naughty Pets have been licensed worldwide to create various products and accessories since 1998.

She is a member of ASCAP, ACTRA, and the Dramatist Guild and sits on the board of All Out Arts. a nonprofit organization dedicated to fighting prejudice through the arts, and the NYMF Alumni Board.

She has guest lectured at The Illustration Conference (ICON3), Parsons School of Design, School of Visual Arts, and The Aldrich Museum of Contemporary Art.

Wendy Ann Gardner is an Honors graduate of the Ontario College of Art and Design (OCAD) Toronto, Canada.

She is currently the composer, lyricist and book writer for a musical adaptation of her children's book, “Yes, A Cat Named Marty Cohen.”

_________________________________

Meet Jonathan!

                                                                   

Jonathan Stuart Cerullo is an award-winning director-choreographer and executive producer and has maintained a career in professional entertainment which spans 35 years to include Broadway, Off-Broadway, Off-Off-Broadway, National Tours, International, Symphony Concerts and Cabaret, Film, and Television and the Circus Arts.

In 2019 not only did he write and stage Amas @50 celebrating Amas Musical Theatre 50th Anniversary honoring Harry Belafonte and The Temptations manager, Shelly Berger he became an Artistic Associate of the organization. The concert was hosted by Tony Award-winner Lillias White and featured Leslie Uggams, Hamilton's Christopher Jackson, and Tony Award-winner Len Cariou. He also directed the industry reading of Carol of Carroll Gardens starring Tony Award-winner Karen Ziemba and Panther City at the Fort Worth Tx. Arts Center.  

In 2018 Jonathan had the great pleasure of directing and choreographing the critically acclaimed all-male version of The Boys from Syracuse at Off-Broadway’s Lion Theatre in NYC. In 2017 he produced and directed the sold-out 30th Anniversary Concert of the Tony-nominated musical Legs Diamond at Feinstein’s / 54 Below gathering back many of the original cast members. Earlier in 2017 he created, wrote and directed for Tony Award-winning lyricists and composer, Lynn Ahrens and Stephen Flaherty, The Flip Side, The Unknown Gems of Ahrens and Flaherty and No Foolin’ at Amas Music Theatre.

Prior to this he directed and choreographed the award-winning musical, Chance for the Fresh Fruit Festival which won the Fruity Award for Outstanding Production Design and Outstanding Performance in a Musical for Courter Simmons, and won Best Director for Fictitious, a new musical by Paul Cozby and Tom Hyndman at SOUNDBITES sponsored by Disney Theatricals and Music Theater International for Theatre Now New York.  For the N.Y. Musical Festival (NYMF) he has directed, Windywoo and Her Naughty Naughty Pets, choreographed Lisa and Leonardo, and Under Fire, which won the NYMF 2009 Best of Fest, and he produced Orphan Train directed by Emmy Award-winning director Patricia Birch. Off-Broadway Jonathan directed and staged Harold Rome’s musical revue, Pins and Needles at La Mama ETC | HOWL Festival, Willie and Me, The Emmett Kelly Story. Earlier in his career he choreographed, Midsummer Nights for Musical Theatre Works, Wonderful Town at the Equity Library Theatre, and directed Uta Hagen’s 50-Year Tribute hosted by Matthew Broderick and Celeste Holm.

For television Jonathan has choreographed, “Orpheus in the Underworld” for, Great Performances; Evening At Pops, and “Dear Mr. Gershwin”, at Canada’s Royal Theatre for CBC, the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation was assistant to the choreographer on, “The First Wives Club”, Donny Osmond's “This Is The Moment”, and “Natalie Cole’s Christmas Special”. Jonathan also had the pleasure of working with Bette Midler by creating the Special Effects Movement for her in Paramount Pictures, “The Stepford Wives”. He also has directed and choreographed for Studio Festi and the New York City “2010 Columbus Day Parade” hosted by television personality Maria Bartiromo, this was broadcast live on both NBC and in Italy on RAI TV. He also conceived, produced and directed the SDC Foundation's tribute video for the Mr. Abbott Award for Lifetime Achievement in Theatre.

He also choreographed the Big Apple Circus’ Carnivale! and Picturesque at Lincoln Center and was choreography consultant for the Broadway production of, Say Goodnight, Gracie starring the late Frank Gorshin. Additional Broadway credits include assistant director/choreographer for Band In Berlin, associate choreographer for Anna Karenina and assistant to two-time Tony Award-winning director and choreographer, Joe Layton on The Three Musketeers.

As a dancer, he was featured in the Broadway production of Legs Diamond, the National Tour of both CATS, and played Big Daddy in Fosse’s Sweet Charity starring Tony Award-winner, Donna McKechnie.

Regionally he choreographed Camelot at the Berkshire Theatre Festival, was private dance instructor to Uta Hagen in Six Dance Lessons at the Geffen Playhouse in Los Angeles. Premiered as director and co-author of, The Fifth Dentist in Search of Sid’s Treasure starring comedian Mike King at the Denver Center for the Performing Arts, and has worked at Theatre by the Sea, North Shore Music Theatre.

He is a proud member of SDC, the Stage Director and Choreographers Society, Actors Equity Association, The Dramatist Guild, and the Drama League, and was honored to serve as Vice-Chair on the SDC Foundation Callaway Award Committee as well as a nominator for the prestigious Lucille Lortel Awards recognizing Off-Broadway theatre. He sits in the Alumni Board for N.Y. Music Festival is an Artistic Advisor for the Music Theatre Factory and volunteers his time to BC|EFA.

JSCTHEATRICALS WEBSITE

_________________________________

WINDYWOO DEVELOPMENT HISTORY

  • JULY 2015 - Accepted in the NY Musical Theatre Festival Staged Reading Series
  • MARCH 2016 - Presented at Atlantic Theatre Company in a reading
  • JUNE 2017 - Recorded "Pets what Are They For" with Remy Zaken
  • JANUARY 2019 - Private Reading - reassembled original NYMF cast
  • FEBRUARY - MARCH  2019 - Dramaturgical work session on a new script and new song completed
  • AUGUST 2019 - Accepted into Amas Musical Theatre Dare to be Different Festival
  • NOVEMBER 2019 - Upcoming 3 Presentations ~ Nov 23 & 24 ART NY Theatres 

_________________________________

MEET AMAS MUSICAL THEATRE!

                                                      

Amas Musical Theatre is a non-profit, multi-ethnic theatrical organization founded in 1968 by Ms. Rosetta LeNoire. Amas (“you love” in Latin) is devoted to the creation, development and professional production of new American musicals through the celebration of diversity and minority perspectives, the emergence of new artistic talent, and the training and encouragement of underserved young people in the New York area.

Amas celebrates its impact in pioneering multi-ethnic casting in the American Theatre and reiterates its commitment to this reflection of our diverse society.

Donna Trinkoff is currently the artistic producer of Amas Musical Theatre, a non-profit performing arts organization in New York City devoted the creation, development and production of new musicals and to the training and encouragement of inner-city young people. Since 1994, Donna has produced the original musicals Broadway and the Bard, starring Len Cariou, Red Eye of Love, The Other Josh Cohen, Triassic Parq! Wanda’s World, Shout! The Mod Musical, Lone Star Love, Magpie, Stormy Weather: The Lena Horne Story, Zanna, Don’t!, Latin Heat, From My Hometown, Langston Hughes’ Little Ham, 4 Guys Named José, Rollin’ on the T.O.B.A., among others, and she has presented over 90 original musicals in the Amas Musical Theatre Lab. As Starry Night Productions, Donna presented the Off-Broadway premiere of SILENCE! The Musical (Christopher Gattelli, Hunter Bell, Jon & Al Kaplan), the unauthorized parody of the iconic film “The Silence of the Lambs” to critical acclaim, sold-out houses, and a two-year run. SILENCE! won the Off-Broadway Alliance Award and the Obie Award for Best Musical and was named as one of the 'Top 10 Plays of the Year' by TIME Magazine. The original cast album has been released on Sh-K-Boom Records. Donna was an associate artistic director at the Cabaret and Performance Conference at the Eugene O’Neill Center in CT and worked with Aruba Productions on new and upcoming musicals. She holds a BA in English and Theatre from SUNY Binghamton, is a graduate of the National Theatre Institute, and she received a Certificate of Merit from the Drama Studio in London. Donna is a member of the League for Professional Theatre Women. She is a recipient of the New York Municipal Art Society Award of Merit and the Galaxy Award from the NY Women’s Association.

AMAS MUSICAL THEATRE WEBSITE

_________________________________

Our first reading program!

                                     

_________________________________

MEET CAROL SCHUBERG

ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR! 

              

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Carol Schuberg (Associate Director) has had the great privilege to be the associate choreographer to Tony Stevens (Sweet Charity, Sheba, Promises Promises), Theodore Pappas (Cabaret, Company, Guys and Dolls, My Fair Lady, Kismet, Pajama Game, A Funny Thing...Forum),  Michael Smuin ("The Fantasticks" movie) and Janet Watson (Gypsy, Anything Goes). Carol directed and choreographed Pippin (Stephens College), Cabaret (Concordia College - Moorhead, MN), and Godspell (Okoboji Summer Theatre). She choreographed Last Dance (York Theatre), Two Gentlemen of Verona (Shakespeare Theater of New Jersey), and Avenue X (Alma Theatre). She performed on Broadway in Meet Me in St.Louis, Off-Broadway in Chess, in National Tours of Cats, Tap Dance Kid, Gigi, Barnum and Regionally in A Chorus Line, Oliver!, A Wonderful Life, Sweet Charity, Cabaret, Gypsy, Bye Bye Birdie, and The Late Henry Moss. She is creating a show about Man Ray and his muse Kiki, titled Under the Light.

_________________________________

MEET STEPHANIE BIANCHI

MUSIC DIRECTOR!

Stephanie Bianchi is a music director, board-certified music therapist, voice-over actor, and composer/lyricist. She has written and performed music and lyrics for a variety of TV and radio shows and ads, independent films, children’s videos, and educational programs. She founded Synaptic Soul - a band of music therapists created to raise music therapy awareness and serve as a platform for MT causes, and wrote all the songs on their 2011 debut album “Awake”. She is also one half of the musical theater writing duo Whiskey and Fall Weather (with Eric C. Webb). Their current projects in development include the irreverent anti-romantic musical comedy “Breakup”, a yet-to-be-titled rock musical about John Wilkes Booth, and a supernatural musical thriller based on a documented New York ghost story. Additionally, she is Music Director for The Guided Imagery Opera, an experimental immersive opera experience created by Joule L’Adara of Sounding Circles.

_________________________________

Amas Musical Theatre's

Dare To Be Different Festival Presents

A Developmental Reading Of

WINDYWOO AND HER NAUGHTY, NAUGHTY PETS

by BWW News Desk Oct. 22, 2019  

Amas Musical Theatre, (Donna Trinkoff, Artistic Producer) presents a developmental reading of Windywoo and Her Naughty Naughty Pets, The Musical, By Wendy Ann Gardner is a new musical based on the popular Naughty Naughty Pets franchise featured on Cartoon Network, with books published by Disney's Hyperion Books for Children. The reading, which is open to the public, takes place as part of Amas Musical Theatre's Dare to Be Different Festival on Nov. 23rd @ 5:00 pm and Nov. 24th, 2019, @ 12:00 & 3:00 pm at the A.R.T/New York Theatres, Mezzanine Theatre, 502 West 53rd Street, NYC.

Windywoo is devastated to learn the building, where they reside, is being sold to a huge New York real estate developer! Their beloved neighborhood is changing, and Hector, the building owner, wants them out! Will the power of pets move the human heart and save the day? Against all odds, Windywoo keeps her family of pets together and learns that a home isn't as important as having someone to come home to.

Windywoo and Her Naughty Naughty Pets, The Musical runs approximately 75 minutes, with 14 songs, and is suitable for all ages.

Windywoo and Her Naughty Naughty Pets delivers a message of human kindness, love of pets, and the importance of families of all kinds. Windywoo empowers through determination, education, and sense of self by standing up for those she loves and triumphs by bringing all those she encounters together in a joyous celebration of the meaning of a family. This delightful story will appeal to audiences of all ages, with real-world situations, infectious songs, and charming humor.

Jonathan Cerullo (The Boys from Syracuse, Band In Berlin, Big Apple Circus, Anna Karenina, Legs Diamond) directs. The creative team includes Stephanie Bianchi (Music Director), Carol Schuberg (Associate Director), and Nikolas George Brown (Stage Manager).

The cast includes, Remy Zaken (Spring Awakening, Brooklynite, Freckleface Strawberry, Off B-way Dear Evan Hanson) leads a cast that includes Soara-Joye Ross (Lortel Award-winner Best Supporting Actress and Drama Desk-nominee for Carmen Jones, Anything Goes), Frank Vlastnik (A Year with Frog and Toad, Sweet Smell of Success, Big),  Ryan Duncan (Gettin’ the Band Back Together, Shrek The Musical, Altar Boyz [Drama League nom]), Daniel Everidge (Grease, Found, Nominated for Drama Desk and Lucille Lortel awards for Lead Actor in Falling (Minetta Lane), Promenade (Encores! Off-Center), Film “The Greatest Showman”), Kathy Searle (“Love in Kilnerry”, “8 Slices”, “Bill Tilghman and the Outlaws), Lulu Picart (R&H Cinderella - First National), Listen to My Heart, Madagascar Live! Disenchanted! (Nominated, Lortel Award), Viet Vo Vietgone, Carousel TV/FILM: “The Blacklist, A Crime to Remember”, “Tales of the City”, Brian LaSoya Indie Film “Zero Charisma”, NY Stand-up Comedian, creator/writer web series 'Public Access' and Alexandra Muscaro With Love, Marilyn.

For online tickets www.amasmusical.org. All shows presented at the beautiful A.R.T./New York Theatres; Mezzanine Theatre located at 502 West 53rd Street (10th Ave & 53rd St) All phone orders: (212) 563-2565 BOX OFFICE: 1 Hour Before Curtain.

Amas gratefully acknowledges the performance space for these productions was subsidized by the A.R.T./New York Theatres Rental Subsidy Fund, a program of the Alliance of Resident Theatres/New York (A.R.T./New York).

Their beloved neighborhood is changing, and Hector, the building owner, wants them out! Will the power of pets move the human heart and save the day?Against all odds, Windywoo keeps her family of pets together and learns that a home isn't as important as having someone to come home to.Windywoo and Her Naughty Naughty Pets delivers a message of human kindness, love of pets, and the importance of families of all kinds. This delightful story will appeal to audiences of all ages, with real-world situations, infectious songs, and charming humor.Please help us reach our goal to present a staged reading atAmas Musical Theatre Dare to be Different Festival this coming November 23 & 24!_________________________________ How is the funding being allocated?ALL DONATIONS ARE TAX-DEDUCTIBLE. _________________________________PLEASE VISIT US ONWINDYWOO WEBSITEINSTAGRAMFACEBOOKTWITTER_________________________________Meet Wendy!                                                       Wendy Ann Gardner (Book/Music/Lyrics) is a composer, lyricist, and author who lives in New York City. She wrote the book, music, and lyrics for an original musical titled Windywoo and Her Naughty Naughty Pets, which was presented in the 2015 New York Musical Theater Festival as a Developmental Reading, directed by award-winning Jonathan Cerullo, produced by Tony Award-winning producer Greg Nobile (Gentlemen’s Guide to Love and Murder, Sweeney Todd, Gypsy) and Seaview Productions.Wendy was nominated for two Gemini Awards in 2006 and 2007 for her Animated TV show, The Naughty Naughty Pets, produced by CBC Canada and Decode Entertainment, which aired on Cartoon Network, CBC, BBC, NHK and has been translated into 7 languages and syndicated worldwide.She also wrote a series of children's books about the Naughty Naughty Pets characters, published by Hyperion Books for Children in 2006. (an imprint of Disney)She is the founder and creator of Scary Stories Inc., which licensed her unique graphics, commissioned by many companies, notably, Target, Nylabone, Paul Frank Industries, Mudpuppy, and Fiesta for use as logos, branding and character art. Her illustrations of the Naughty Naughty Pets have been licensed worldwide to create various products and accessories since 1998.She is a member of ASCAP, ACTRA, and the Dramatist Guild and sits on the board of All Out Arts. a nonprofit organization dedicated to fighting prejudice through the arts, and the NYMF Alumni Board.She has guest lectured at The Illustration Conference (ICON3), Parsons School of Design, School of Visual Arts, and The Aldrich Museum of Contemporary Art.Wendy Ann Gardner is an Honors graduate of the Ontario College of Art and Design (OCAD) Toronto, Canada.She is currently the composer, lyricist and book writer for a musical adaptation of her children's book, “Yes, A Cat Named Marty Cohen.”_________________________________Meet Jonathan!                                                                    Jonathan Stuart Cerullo is an award-winning director-choreographer and executive producer and has maintained a career in professional entertainment which spans 35 years to include Broadway, Off-Broadway, Off-Off-Broadway, National Tours, International, Symphony Concerts and Cabaret, Film, and Television and the Circus Arts.In 2019 not only did he write and stage Amas @50 celebrating Amas Musical Theatre 50th Anniversary honoring Harry Belafonte and The Temptations manager, Shelly Berger he became an Artistic Associate of the organization. The concert was hosted by Tony Award-winner Lillias White and featured Leslie Uggams, Hamilton's Christopher Jackson, and Tony Award-winner Len Cariou. He also directed the industry reading of Carol of Carroll Gardens starring Tony Award-winner Karen Ziemba and Panther City at the Fort Worth Tx. Arts Center.  In 2018 Jonathan had the great pleasure of directing and choreographing the critically acclaimed all-male version of The Boys from Syracuse at Off-Broadway’s Lion Theatre in NYC. In 2017 he produced and directed the sold-out 30th Anniversary Concert of the Tony-nominated musical Legs Diamond at Feinstein’s / 54 Below gathering back many of the original cast members. Earlier in 2017 he created, wrote and directed for Tony Award-winning lyricists and composer, Lynn Ahrens and Stephen Flaherty, The Flip Side, The Unknown Gems of Ahrens and Flaherty and No Foolin’ at Amas Music Theatre.Prior to this he directed and choreographed the award-winning musical, Chance for the Fresh Fruit Festival which won the Fruity Award for Outstanding Production Design and Outstanding Performance in a Musical for Courter Simmons, and won Best Director for Fictitious, a new musical by Paul Cozby and Tom Hyndman at SOUNDBITES sponsored by Disney Theatricals and Music Theater International for Theatre Now New York.  For the N.Y. Musical Festival (NYMF) he has directed, Windywoo and Her Naughty Naughty Pets, choreographed Lisa and Leonardo, and Under Fire, which won the NYMF 2009 Best of Fest, and he produced Orphan Train directed by Emmy Award-winning director Patricia Birch. Off-Broadway Jonathan directed and staged Harold Rome’s musical revue, Pins and Needles at La Mama ETC | HOWL Festival, Willie and Me, The Emmett Kelly Story. Earlier in his career he choreographed, Midsummer Nights for Musical Theatre Works, Wonderful Town at the Equity Library Theatre, and directed Uta Hagen’s 50-Year Tribute hosted by Matthew Broderick and Celeste Holm.For television Jonathan has choreographed, “Orpheus in the Underworld” for, Great Performances; Evening At Pops, and “Dear Mr. Gershwin”, at Canada’s Royal Theatre for CBC, the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation was assistant to the choreographer on, “The First Wives Club”, Donny Osmond's “This Is The Moment”, and “Natalie Cole’s Christmas Special”. Jonathan also had the pleasure of working with Bette Midler by creating the Special Effects Movement for her in Paramount Pictures, “The Stepford Wives”. He also has directed and choreographed for Studio Festi and the New York City “2010 Columbus Day Parade” hosted by television personality Maria Bartiromo, this was broadcast live on both NBC and in Italy on RAI TV. He also conceived, produced and directed the SDC Foundation's tribute video for the Mr. Abbott Award for Lifetime Achievement in Theatre.He also choreographed the Big Apple Circus’ Carnivale! and Picturesque at Lincoln Center and was choreography consultant for the Broadway production of, Say Goodnight, Gracie starring the late Frank Gorshin. Additional Broadway credits include assistant director/choreographer for Band In Berlin, associate choreographer for Anna Karenina and assistant to two-time Tony Award-winning director and choreographer, Joe Layton on The Three Musketeers.As a dancer, he was featured in the Broadway production of Legs Diamond, the National Tour of both CATS, and played Big Daddy in Fosse’s Sweet Charity starring Tony Award-winner, Donna McKechnie.Regionally he choreographed Camelot at the Berkshire Theatre Festival, was private dance instructor to Uta Hagen in Six Dance Lessons at the Geffen Playhouse in Los Angeles. Premiered as director and co-author of, The Fifth Dentist in Search of Sid’s Treasure starring comedian Mike King at the Denver Center for the Performing Arts, and has worked at Theatre by the Sea, North Shore Music Theatre.He is a proud member of SDC, the Stage Director and Choreographers Society, Actors Equity Association, The Dramatist Guild, and the Drama League, and was honored to serve as Vice-Chair on the SDC Foundation Callaway Award Committee as well as a nominator for the prestigious Lucille Lortel Awards recognizing Off-Broadway theatre. He sits in the Alumni Board for N.Y. Music Festival is an Artistic Advisor for the Music Theatre Factory and volunteers his time to BC|EFA.JSCTHEATRICALS WEBSITE_________________________________WINDYWOO DEVELOPMENT HISTORY

story:
In 5 Schritten zum 5. Festival // 5ème Festival en 5 étapes 


Die Raubtiere streifen schon ganz ungeduldig durch die Ménagerie, denn im Mai 2014 ist es endlich soweit: Unser französischsprachiges Theaterfestival geht in die fünfte Runde!

Vom 23. bis 25. Mai 2014 füllt La Ménagerie e.V. eine Berliner Bühne mit Künstlern, geeint durch die Begeisterung für das darstellende Spiel und die französische Sprache!  

Die professionellen Künstler kommen aus Frankreich und Deutschland, aber auch aus Italien, Österreich, Griechenland und Luxemburg.

Im Programm: turtelnde Begegnungen, eine Gurusitzung, Texte von Prévert, Gedanken über Patrick Dewaere, Geschichten einer Nachtigall, Abenteuer des fiesesten aller Piraten, fantastische Märchen, improvisierte Sketche … Verfeinert wird unser Festival durch das Programm im OFF mit Überraschungsauftritten und Workshops unserer Berliner Raubtiere.


D’un bout à l’autre de la Ménagerie, les fauves font les cent pas. Ils grognent, ils s’agitent… Ils attendent la 5ème édition du Festival du Théâtre Francophone !

Cette année encore la Ménagerie e.V. réunira du 23 au 25 mai 2014 sur des planches berlinoises des artistes des quatre coins de l’Europe qui ont deux points communs : l’amour du théâtre et de la langue française. Nous accueillerons en effet des artistes venus de France et d’Allemagne bien sûr, mais aussi d’Italie, d’Autriche, de Grèce et du Luxembourg.  

Au programme, des rencontres amoureuses, un gourou, un moment avec Prévert et un autre avec Patrick Dewaere, les aventures d’un rossignol et celles du pirate le plus méchant de tous les pirates ou encore un match d’impro et une expo photo. Des ateliers et autres surprises organisés par nos fauves attendront également les spectateurs entre chaque représentation.




In den letzten vier Jahren begeisterte unser Festival ein breites Publikum: ganz gleich, ob jung oder alt, Berliner oder Angereiste, Theatermuffel oder –insider, enthusiastisch oder skeptisch, frankophon oder frankophil! 

Die Stücke sind auf Französisch, aber keine Angst, deutsche Übertitelungen helfen allen, die sprachlich nicht 100 %ig sicher sind. Auch dieses Jahr richtet sich unser Festival ohne Unterschied an alle, die neugierig auf unalltägliche Erfahrungen und starke Momente auf der Bühne und in den Zuschauerrängen sind.


Le Festival rassemble depuis 5 ans un public large: Berlinois et étrangers, francophones et francophiles, passionnés de théâtre ou spectateurs occasionnels, petits et grands, se retrouvent pour partager un moment de théâtre dans la convivialité. 

Que ceux qui ne maîtrisent pas le français à 100% se rassurent : toutes les pièces sont surtitrées en allemand. Cette année encore le Festival s’adresse à tous les curieux en quête de moments forts et d’expériences qui sortent de l’ordinaire.



Französischsprachiges Theater in Berlin – Das ist sicherlich kein exotisches Hobby oder unnütze Liebhaberei. Spitzt man die Ohren, so hört man französische Worte an allen Ecken, den touristischen Sehenswürdigkeiten, kleinen Neuköllner Eckkneipen… 

Unser Festival möchte Raum für den interkulturellen Austausch geben:

  • für Deutschsprachige, um in Kontakt mit der französischen Sprache zu treten
  • für Frankophone, um in Berlin ein Stück Heimat wiederzufinden
  • für frankophone Künstler, um in der deutschen Hauptstadt künstlerisch Fuß zu fassen
  • für Neugierige, um brandaktuelle Theaterprojekte zu entdecken
  • für all die genannten unter-, über- und miteinander

Unser Ziel ist es, feinstes unabhängiges Theater auf die Bühne zu bringen!


Un festival de théâtre francophone à Berlin, c’est plus logique qu’il n’y paraît ! En se baladant dans les rues de Berlin, il suffit de tendre l’oreille pour entendre parler français dans tous les coins, des sites touristiques de Mitte aux petits bars de Neukölln… Notre Festival se veut un réel espace d’échange interculturel :

  • Pour les germanophones qui veulent se frotter à la langue française
  • Pour les francophones qui veulent retrouver un bout de chez soi
  • Pour les artistes français qui veulent s’établir dans la capitale allemande
  • Pour les curieux qui veulent découvrir des projets de théâtre qui sortent de l’ordinaire

Pour tous ceux-ci et les autres, notre but est de donner une chance au théâtre francophone indépendant de s’exprimer !



Mit eurer finanziellen Unterstützungen werden wir Folgendes bezahlen:

  • Miet- und Nebenkosten im Theater ACUD
  • technische Ausstattung
  • logistische Aufwendungen und Catering
  • fünf Kerzen für den Geburtstagskuchen

Hierein wird eure finanzielle Unterstützung NICHT fließen:

  • in unsere Taschen!

Denn alle Künstler, Köche, Techniker, Übersetzer, Redakteure, Putzkräfte, Kartenverkäufer, kurz: alle Mitwirkende arbeiten EHRENAMTLICH, sprich UNENTGELTLICH!


Votre argent ira dans : 

  • La location et l’entretien de l’ACUD Theater, le lieu du Festival
  • Les équipements techniques
  • Les frais de logistique et le catering
  • Les cinq bougies du gâteau d’anniversaire !

Votre argent N'IRA PAS dans :

  • Nos poches !

Tous les artistes, traducteurs, organisateurs, techniciens, restaurateurs ou encore ouvreurs donneront de leur temps et leur talent de manière complètement BENEVOLE ! 



Das Festival wird von der Theaterplattform La Ménagerie e.V. ausgerichtet. Durch unsere theaterpädagogischen Interventionen an mehreren Berliner Schulen, Theaterunterricht und Workshops sowie die vielseitigen Events sind wir für frankophone und frankophile Berliner keine Unbekannten mehr.

Verantwortlich für dieses Projekt sind Damien Poinsard, Vorsitz von La Ménagerie e.V., sowie Alexandra Henn, Koordination des Festivals. Mit im Team sind:

  • für die Logistik: Sabine Bosler
  • für die Technik: Vincent Lemoine
  • für die französischsprachige Pressearbeit und Grafik: Géraldine Satre Buisson
  • für die deutschsprachige Pressearbeit: Maria Fritzsche
  • für die französischsprachige Pressearbeit: Joséphine Dusol

Unterstützt werden sie von allen Raubtieren, die sich mit ihren wilden Mähnen und verrückten Ideen in der Ménagerie tummeln!


La Ménagerie e.V. est la plateforme de théâtre en français de Berlin. Association reconnue d'intérêt public, elle propose des interventions pédagogiques dans les écolies, des ateliers hebdomadaires, des formations pour les professionels et des spectacles.

L’équipe est menée par Alexandra Henn, coordinatrice du Festival et Damien Poinsard, président de La Ménagerie. Ils sont aidés par:

  • Sabine Bosler à la logistique
  • Vincent Lemoine à la technique
  • Géraldine Satre Buisson aux relations presse francophone et graphisme
  • Maria Fritzsche aux relations presse germanophone
  • Joséphine Dusol aux relations presse francophone 

Ainsi que toute la horde des fauves de la Ménagerie !

 

Die Stickers und Stoffbeutel können während des Festivals abgeholt werden. 

Les récompenses autocollants et sacs seront à retirer pendant le Festival.
story_txt:
In 5 Schritten zum 5. Festival // 5ème Festival en 5 étapes Die Raubtiere streifen schon ganz ungeduldig durch die Ménagerie, denn im Mai 2014 ist es endlich soweit: Unser französischsprachiges Theaterfestival geht in die fünfte Runde!Vom 23. bis 25. Mai 2014 füllt La Ménagerie e.V. eine Berliner Bühne mit Künstlern, geeint durch die Begeisterung für das darstellende Spiel und die französische Sprache!  Die professionellen Künstler kommen aus Frankreich und Deutschland, aber auch aus Italien, Österreich, Griechenland und Luxemburg. Im Programm: turtelnde Begegnungen, eine Gurusitzung, Texte von Prévert, Gedanken über Patrick Dewaere, Geschichten einer Nachtigall, Abenteuer des fiesesten aller Piraten, fantastische Märchen, improvisierte Sketche … Verfeinert wird unser Festival durch das Programm im OFF mit Überraschungsauftritten und Workshops unserer Berliner Raubtiere.D’un bout à l’autre de la Ménagerie, les fauves font les cent pas. Ils grognent, ils s’agitent… Ils attendent la 5ème édition du Festival du Théâtre Francophone !Cette année encore la Ménagerie e.V. réunira du 23 au 25 mai 2014 sur des planches berlinoises des artistes des quatre coins de l’Europe qui ont deux points communs : l’amour du théâtre et de la langue française. Nous accueillerons en effet des artistes venus de France et d’Allemagne bien sûr, mais aussi d’Italie, d’Autriche, de Grèce et du Luxembourg.  Au programme, des rencontres amoureuses, un gourou, un moment avec Prévert et un autre avec Patrick Dewaere, les aventures d’un rossignol et celles du pirate le plus méchant de tous les pirates ou encore un match d’impro et une expo photo. Des ateliers et autres surprises organisés par nos fauves attendront également les spectateurs entre chaque représentation.In den letzten vier Jahren begeisterte unser Festival ein breites Publikum: ganz gleich, ob jung oder alt, Berliner oder Angereiste, Theatermuffel oder –insider, enthusiastisch oder skeptisch, frankophon oder frankophil! Die Stücke sind auf Französisch, aber keine Angst, deutsche Übertitelungen helfen allen, die sprachlich nicht 100 %ig sicher sind. Auch dieses Jahr richtet sich unser Festival ohne Unterschied an alle, die neugierig auf unalltägliche Erfahrungen und starke Momente auf der Bühne und in den Zuschauerrängen sind.Le Festival rassemble depuis 5 ans un public large: Berlinois et étrangers, francophones et francophiles, passionnés de théâtre ou spectateurs occasionnels, petits et grands, se retrouvent pour partager un moment de théâtre dans la convivialité. Que ceux qui ne maîtrisent pas le français à 100% se rassurent : toutes les pièces sont surtitrées en allemand. story:
Welcome to ICT's World Premiere Presentation of "R+J Equal Love"

"ICT is always committed to daring, and explorative theatrical events. It’s the same kind of art that moves me, and definitely strive to create. This world premier production is exciting, powerful and timely. I’m proud to be directing this unique, delicious, and even fearless piece. And, I’m more grateful for ICT's unlimited creative support." -- Director Casey Kringlen

Within our polarized world, a lot of young people suffer from lack of love, and misunderstanding. Some become bullies and lash out at others. Some lash out at themselves and become the unfortunate victims of suicide. “R+J Equal Love” can be a cautionary tale that offers its audiences an opportunity to confront the unnecessary pain caused by intolerance. The motive of this project is to remind us that we are all human, worthy of love, acceptance, and understanding. Our ultimate responsibility is to accept - and better yet - to provide for each other: True. Equal. Love.

This unique adaption of Shakespeare's classic love story, Romeo and Juliet, playfully challenges society's concept of equality through the artistic vision of director, Casey Kringlen.  Audience members can expect a raw, energetic experience as they are transported into the world of Montague and Capulet through unconventional casting, staging and design.  Set in two one-hour acts, with a male-male Romeo and Juliet for one, and a female-female Romeo and Juliet for the other, the show promises to engage theatre goers artistically from the moment they enter.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Raising funds via Indiegogo will allow us to shake up how we present our theatrical affair.  Our production will not take place in a theater, but in a downtown event space.  Theater goers will be able to watch the show in the round as actors strut up and down the runway-like stages, while other scenes play as projections on the wall. 

Our perks allow you, theater lover, different ways to view event.  If we don't reach our entire goal, money raised will be put towards the R+J Equal Love show.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

One amazing way we can reach our goal, and perhaps more, is by word of mouth support from people just like you. You can start by sharing on Twitter and Facebook that you donated and linking back to this page. This will encourage your friends and followers to see what you're supporting (if you like it, so will they!).

If you're in Los Angeles, you can also help by spreading the word about our shows. We can't deliver great theater if we don't have an audience to deliver it to - please come out to the theater, and bring a friend!

story:
We are overwhelmed and humbled by your generosity and belief in Serrano.  We’re asking you to take one more step in these final days before our campaign ends on Thursday, September 11th.  Buy your tickets NOW!

There are still a few opening night tickets left, which includes the VIP After Party, plus great deals to be had and advance tickets for all performances.  We know that tickets are going to sell like hot cakes (do hot cakes sell any more?).

Everyone who contributes to this campaign is automatically part of the Serrano Family, which means taking the trip with us from LA to Broadway—with special offers, opportunities and perks along the way ... So, what are you waiting for?!


About Serrano, the musical….   

(www.SerranoTheMusical.com), SERRANO is an homage to the French classic, "Cyrano de Bergerac." and is directed by the prolific, Joel Zwick (Tony nominee, no less!).  In our adaptation, “Serrano” works for “Don Reyo,” a mobster in Little Italy with an uncouth and foul-mouthed nephew, “Vinnie,” who just happens to have the face of Adonis.  "Serrano" secretly pines for the lovely "Rosanna," but believes she could never see past his unsightly nose (which is too large by half!) “Don Reyo” orders “Serrano” to teach his nephew how to woo the beautiful "Rosanna" for his own ill gotten means, and poor Rosanna doesn’t stand a chance.  She falls in love with the beautiful words of “Serrano,” but the sweet face of ‘Vinnie”!  
 

Here is a song from the musical,"Serrano" - "Serrano" is singing of how deeply he loves "Rosanna" …. press "play" and listen to our beautiful ballad, "Rosanna."

About Us…..

Our dream is big….to bring "SERRANO" to Broadway.  Our goal (and this is where we need YOUR help) is to first put on a 12-week production of SERRANO in Los Angeles, in January.  We are on track to do just that with your help to date!    

The road to Broadway starts out-of-town.  We have secured The Matrix Theatre in Los Angeles, whose artistic director saw the play and loved it and offered up their space to us.  It's a terrific theatre with a great reputation for spotlighting new work. Now all we need is a budget!  We need to raise $60,000+ to pull this off and with your help, we KNOW we can do it…..
…wouldn't it be great to say you played a pivotal part in launching SERRANO, the musical - BEFORE it hit Broadway? Any perk level you purchase will give you these bragging rights, no amount too small (or too large!)
Just think somewhere out there, there are people still talking about how they supported "Jersey Boys" and "Wicked" long before those great shows hit a Broadway stage!

Here's part of our team today…..   

Left to right, producers Mark Wolper & Spencer Proffer, director Joel Zwick and producer, Phillipa Sledge

….and part of our team back then!   Our producer, Mark Wolper, was dreaming of Broadway as a boy - here he is above, after "producing" a staged production of "Goldilocks"- (that's his sister as "Goldilocks", and his dad as "Papa Bear"!)  

We love theatre and we love this play.  We’re totally committed to getting SERRANO into The Matrix in January - and we know if enough people feel as strongly about musical theatre as we do, that we can do it.  Yes, people have told us we're crazy to aim for Broadway without Broadway experience…. but if you think about it, if we listened to negative nellies, we wouldn't have a man on the moon, or electricity or … running water for that matter!  Nothing GREAT is accomplished by listening to naysayers, right?  So here we are … after multiple staged readings and workshops in New York and Los Angeles …  so close that we can smell the grease paint!   We are asking you, the philanthropic crowdfunders, lovers and dreamers, defender of of the arts - because you truly do understand what it is we are taking on, and what we want to accomplish - and you want to join us anyway!  Dream with us, help us turn this dream into a reality.  Because with your help, we know that we CAN mount SERRANO at The Matrix in L.A........and then it's on to Broadway!

Above is Serrano's beloved director, Joel Zwick - (he directed Mork & Mindy, Laverne & Shirley, Full House, Busom Buddies … oh yes, and he directed one of the most successful films of all time "My Big Fat Greek Wedding")
We've workshopped and showcased "Serrano" A LOT!  It's part of the process and although we've still to stage it - we have had extremely good feedback from audiences who have attended these staged readings.  We've posted a few below o you can see that it's not just us who LOVE "Serrano." 
Ernest Dickerson, director of the iconic TV show, "The Walking Dead," was an early supporter of "Serrano" - here he is with Rose Geddes, from an undisclosed location, safe from Zombies, and sharing their "Serrano" experience:


Joel Zwick & producer, Steve Sunshine, being interviewed on "Innovation Crush" a popular online show with over 600,000 subscribers!

Just listening to Joel Zwick, and our producer, Steve Sunshine, talk about starting out in the industry is entertaining!  The interview is more anecdotal and humorous than it is serious - but the gems just kept on coming - it's a really fun interview by Chris Denson, of Innovation Crush who clearly did his homework.  Our boys tell tales from the sets of iconic TV shows and they even "throw down" in a duel we could call  "the battle of the name drop"!  From Gary Marshall to Tom Hanks, & Jon Stewart to Emmanuel Lewis…listen here for the entire interview….

 "RADIO INTERVIEW W/JOEL ZWICK & STEVE SUNSHINE" 

Above: Chris Denson (left), Steve Sunshine (middle) Joel Zwick (right) being interviewed about their careers and the road to here on SERRANO! (we learned so much - like did you know that Steven Spielberg shadowed Joel on the set of Laverne & Shirley to learn how to direct comedy?  And we are offering a week to shadow Joel on a set of a TV show as a perk - could you be the next Spielberg?!
 Take a listen - gems!
Jerry Penicoli live from the Emmy's LOVES Serrano - and like us, believes we can make it to Broadway!


Our Staged Readings and Workshops...

Our multiple staged readings in NY and LA have been met with great enthusiasm, even standing ovations (even actors, Greg Kinnear and Mario Lopez have seen it and loved it!  See below under "Testimonials") 

Helmed by our Tony nominee Joel Zwick, we've put together a talented creative team, that includes Broadway actors who LOVE this show, and are so PASSIONATE about being in SERRANO in January that they are helping us think up perks to give away in return for your support!  "SERRANO" himself has offered to serenade a limited number of donors (or their loved ones!) with one song from "SERRANO" over Skype!  And he's a Broadway actor no less!  Now that's serious brownie points in ANY relationship! 

"Serrano" pining for the love of his life, "Rosanna"
The photo below is from an earlier SERRANO workshop.  "SERRANO" tries to give "Vinnie" some education - no easy job!  "Vinnie" is a handful, and a very "bad boy". 

"Serrano" & "Vinnie" in rehearsal

Our Perks…...

BEFORE WE EXCITE YOU WITH OUR PERKS…. PLEASE KNOW THAT ANY OF OUR PERKS CAN BE PURCHASED FOR YOURSELF, OR GIFTED TO A FRIEND OR FAMILY MEMBER, LOVED ONE OR WORK MATE! We've sold perks to donors in New Zealand, England, Australia, Hong Kong and Greece!   

In return for your pledges, we created some really exciting higher level Indiegogo rewards -- but it can't be stated strongly enough that your support for us at every level is equally important to us, whether purchasing "early bird" or "advanced tickets," or venturing into the larger perks, such as a whole week shadowing director, Joel Zwick on a popular TV show, or a week with him in rehearsals on "Serrano".  Would you like to "feel" like a producer on our L.A. production?  We have Associate Producer and Executive Producer titles on offer that will make you feel like royalty!  Although they are only what we call, "vanity credits," (meaning you won't be burdened with any financial, legal, creative or business attachments etc), you'll still get a taste of what it "feels" like to be a producer on a successful show - and in Los Angeles no less!  Additionally, we have an amazing opportunity for a meet and greet with award winning producer, Mark Wolper from the Wolper Organization and, if you’ve dreamed of acting, a chance to audition for the Wolper Organization's shows for three years!   We have sold out all our tickets to "Dancing with the Stars,"  "The Voice,"  "American Idol," and "So You Think You Can Dance" -  but we still have GREAT perks available for anyone interested in the entertainment industry!   FOR A FULL LISTING AND THE "DISCLAIMERS" FOR OUR PERKS, PLEASE VISIT OUR SERRANO WEBSITE 

**CLICK HERE TO LISTEN**


You can proudly say you received all of these perks back before "Serrano" was a huge success on Broadway! (There are more incentives but we have a limited amount of space here - the entire list is posted to the right!) And our rewards start as low as $5 because every contribution moves us towards our goal of Broadway. For a complete description of pledges,  please click here.
Our Website…...
Here's a link to our website, it tells you who we are, how far we've come, and what's still ahead. We know you have a lot of choices when choosing to support a project - we hope you feel our passion for "Serrano" and our unwavering belief that we will get it to "Broadway" by way of a 12-week run in Los Angeles - starting this January!  Please join the SERRANO movement!  Become our cheerleaders and be a part of something great!

Below are some candid photos of our cast & creative team:

Producer David Geha with Paula Abdul and Extra's, Terri Seymour

Emmy winning producer Steve Sunshine on the red carpet

Other Ways You Can Help..... 

We understand that you may not be able to donate, but there are other ways you can help us.  Our website tells our story: how far we've come and what's still left to do.  Please share the link to this Indigogo page & "like" us on our Facebook Fan Page and you can now follow us on Twitter too @SerranoBroadway.  Indigogo makes it easy - just use the share tools!  

Thank you for your support, we can't do this without you!  

Our Author & Lyricist, Madeline Sunshine - with Maizie Sunshine!

Our composer, Robert Tepper

Jeff Rizzo our Musical Director

The beautiful 'Rosanna"

"The Dishy Tarts" - in rehearsal

Sing it Mama! Mama gives Rosanna a pep talk about "Bad Boys"


"Vinnie Pepperini" - The Bad Boy

Some Testimonials…...

"I was invited to see a very early staged reading of Serrano in Los Angeles and I loved it.  I knew leaving the theater that night that I had seen something very special.  The story is hilarious, the music is wonderful and the talented Joel Zwick has put together an amazing cast.  I can't wait to see it again."
Greg Kinnear, Actor
"I was fortunate enough to see a staged reading of "Serrano."  I love musical theater and my wife and I left that night singing the songs and laughing at the lines! It’s a sure fire hit.” 
Mario Lopez - "Extra" Host, Actor

Live from the Emmys - "Extra" Producer, Omar Lugones, on
why you will love "Serrano" .....
"It's the most fun you'll have with your clothes on!"


Terri Seymour, TV Correspondent and Host of "Extra" shares her
love of "Serrano"

"I had the great fortune of watching a staged reading of Serrano and, wow, I am so happy I was invited to do so…the writing was entertaining and very funny, but also very sweet, with lots of great music and songs.  I am a person who likes to sit down whenever possible, especially since I am on my feet most of the day, but this was standing room only for me and I enjoyed every minute of it!"  Christine Norton, RN
"Extra,"
Below, we asked an audience member leaving "Serrano" what she thought of the staged reading and she was happy to tell us!

Why writer/director, Brian Herzlinger wants to support "Serrano"

Risk:  There are always risks and challenges with any project.  However, we can't foresee any that would prevent SERRANO, the new musical comedy, from playing at The Matrix Theatre in Los Angeles in January if we raise our goal!
story_txt:
We are overwhelmed and humbled by your generosity and belief
in Serrano.  We’re asking you to take one
more step in these final days before our campaign ends on Thursday,
September 11th.  Buy your tickets
NOW! There are still a few opening night tickets left, which includes
the VIP After Party, plus great deals to be had and advance tickets for all
performances.  We know that tickets are
going to sell like hot cakes (do hot cakes sell any more?).
Everyone who contributes to this campaign is automatically
part of the Serrano Family, which means taking the trip with us from LA to
Broadway—with special offers, opportunities and perks along the way ... So, what are you waiting for?!About Serrano, the musical….   (www.SerranoTheMusical.com), SERRANO is an homage to the French classic, "Cyrano de Bergerac." and is directed by the prolific, Joel Zwick (Tony nominee, no less!).  In our adaptation, “Serrano”
works for “Don Reyo,” a mobster in Little Italy with an uncouth and
foul-mouthed nephew, “Vinnie,” who just happens to have the face of Adonis.  "Serrano" secretly pines for the lovely "Rosanna," but believes she could never see past his unsightly nose (which is too large by half!) “Don Reyo” orders “Serrano” to teach his nephew how to woo the beautiful "Rosanna" for his own ill gotten means, and poor Rosanna doesn’t stand a
chance.  She falls in love with the beautiful words of “Serrano,” but the
sweet face of ‘Vinnie”!  

  Here is a song from the musical,"Serrano" - "Serrano" is singing of how deeply he loves "Rosanna" …. press "play" and listen to our beautiful ballad, "Rosanna."



About Us…..


Our dream is big….to bring "SERRANO" to Broadway.  Our goal (and this is where we need YOUR help) is to first put on a 12-week production of SERRANO in Los Angeles, in January.  We are on track to do just that with your help to date!    




The road to Broadway starts out-of-town.  We have secured The Matrix Theatre in Los Angeles, whose artistic director saw the play and loved it and offered up their space to us.  It's a terrific theatre with a great reputation for spotlighting new work. Now all we need is a budget!  We need to raise $60,000+ to pull this off and with your help, we KNOW we can do it…..
…wouldn't it be great to say you played a pivotal part in launching SERRANO, the musical - BEFORE it hit Broadway? Any perk level you purchase will give you these bragging rights, no amount too small (or too large!)
Just think somewhere out there, there are people still talking about how they supported "Jersey Boys" and "Wicked" long before those great shows hit a Broadway stage!


Here's part of our team today…..   

Left to right, producers Mark Wolper & Spencer Proffer, director Joel Zwick and producer, Phillipa Sledge


….and part of our team back then!   Our producer, Mark Wolper, was dreaming of Broadway as a boy - here he is above, after "producing" a staged production of "Goldilocks"- (that's his sister as "Goldilocks", and his dad as "Papa Bear"!)  
We love theatre and we love this play.  We’re totally committed to getting SERRANO into The Matrix in January - and we know if enough people feel as strongly about musical theatre as we do, that we can do it.  Yes, people have told us we're crazy to aim for Broadway without Broadway experience…. but if you think about it, if we listened to negative nellies, we wouldn't have a man on the moon, or electricity or … running water for that matter!  Nothing GREAT is accomplished by listening to naysayers, right?  So here we are … after multiple staged readings and workshops in New York and Los Angeles …  so close that we can smell the grease paint!   We are asking you, the philanthropic crowdfunders, lovers and dreamers, defender of of the arts - because you truly do understand what it is we are taking on, and what we want to accomplish - and you want to join us anyway!  Dream with us, help us turn this dream into a reality.  Because with your help, we know that we CAN mount SERRANO at The Matrix in L.A........and then it's on to Broadway!

Above is Serrano's beloved director, Joel Zwick - (he directed Mork & Mindy, Laverne & Shirley, Full House, Busom Buddies … oh yes, and he directed one of the most successful films of all time "My Big Fat Greek Wedding")
We've workshopped and showcased "Serrano" A LOT!  It's part of the process and although we've still to stage it - we have had extremely good feedback from audiences who have attended these staged readings.  We've posted a few below o you can see that it's not just us who LOVE "Serrano." 

Ernest Dickerson, director of the iconic TV show, "The Walking Dead," was an early supporter of "Serrano" - here he is with Rose Geddes, from an undisclosed location, safe from Zombies, and sharing their "Serrano" experience:

Joel Zwick & producer, Steve Sunshine, being interviewed on "Innovation Crush" a popular online show with over 600,000 subscribers! 

Just listening to Joel Zwick, and our producer, Steve Sunshine, talk about starting out in the industry is entertaining!  The interview is more anecdotal and humorous than it is serious - but the gems just kept on coming - it's a really fun interview by Chris Denson, of Innovation Crush who clearly did his homework.  Our boys tell tales from the sets of iconic TV shows and they even "throw down" in a duel we could call  "the battle of the name drop"!  From Gary Marshall to Tom Hanks, & Jon Stewart to Emmanuel Lewis…listen here for the entire interview….

 "RADIO INTERVIEW W/JOEL ZWICK & STEVE SUNSHINE" 




Above: Chris Denson (left), Steve Sunshine (middle) Joel Zwick (right) being interviewed about their careers and the road to here on SERRANO! (we learned so much - like did you know that Steven Spielberg shadowed Joel on the set of Laverne & Shirley to learn how to direct comedy?  And we are offering a week to shadow Joel on a set of a TV show as a perk - could you be the next Spielberg?!  Take a listen - gems!

Jerry Penicoli live from the Emmy's LOVES Serrano - and like us, believes we can make it to Broadway!


Our Staged Readings and Workshops...
Our multiple staged readings in NY and LA have been met with great enthusiasm, even standing ovations (even actors, Greg Kinnear and Mario Lopez have seen it and loved it!  See below under "Testimonials")  
Helmed by our Tony nominee Joel Zwick, we've put together a talented creative team, that includes Broadway actors who LOVE this show, and are so PASSIONATE about being in SERRANO in January that they are helping us think up perks to give away in return for your support!  "SERRANO" himself has offered to serenade a limited number of donors (or their loved ones!) with one song from "SERRANO" over Skype!  And he's a Broadway actor no less!  Now that's serious brownie points in ANY relationship!  


"Serrano" pining for the love of his life, "Rosanna"

The photo below is from an earlier SERRANO workshop.  "SERRANO" tries to give "Vinnie" some education - no easy job!  "Vinnie" is a handful, and a very "bad boy". 
"Serrano" & "Vinnie" in rehearsal Our Perks…...
BEFORE WE EXCITE YOU WITH OUR PERKS…. PLEASE KNOW THAT ANY OF OUR PERKS CAN BE PURCHASED FOR YOURSELF, OR GIFTED TO A FRIEND OR FAMILY MEMBER, LOVED ONE OR WORK MATE! We've sold perks to donors in New Zealand, England, Australia, Hong Kong and Greece!   
In return for your pledges, we created some really exciting higher level Indiegogo rewards -- but it can't be stated strongly enough that your support for us at every level is equally important to us, whether purchasing "early bird" or "advanced tickets," or venturing into the larger perks, such as a whole week shadowing director, Joel Zwick on a popular TV show, or a week with him in rehearsals on "Serrano".  Would you like to "feel" like a producer on our L.A. production?  We have Associate Producer and Executive Producer titles on offer that will make you feel like royalty!  Although they are only what we call, "vanity credits," (meaning you won't be burdened with any financial, legal, creative or business attachments etc), you'll still get a taste of what it "feels" like to be a producer on a successful show - and in Los Angeles no less!  Additionally, we have an amazing opportunity for a meet and greet with award winning producer, Mark Wolper from the Wolper Organization and, if you’ve dreamed of acting, a chance to audition for the Wolper Organization's shows for three years!   We have sold out all our tickets to "Dancing with the Stars,"  "The Voice,"  "American Idol," and "So You Think You Can Dance" -  but we still have GREAT perks available for anyone interested in the entertainment industry!   FOR A FULL LISTING AND THE "DISCLAIMERS" FOR OUR PERKS, PLEASE VISIT OUR SERRANO WEBSITE 
**CLICK HERE TO LISTEN**
 



You can proudly say you received all of these perks back before "Serrano" was a huge success on Broadway! (There are more incentives but we have a limited amount of space here - the entire list is posted to the right!) And our rewards start as low as $5 because every contribution moves us towards our goal of Broadway. For a complete description of pledges,  please click here.


Our Website…...


Here's a link to our website, it tells you who we are, how far we've come, and what's still ahead. We know you have a lot of choices when choosing to support a project - we hope you feel our passion for "Serrano" and our unwavering belief that we will get it to "Broadway" by way of a 12-week run in Los Angeles - starting this January!  Please join the SERRANO movement!  Become our cheerleaders and be a part of something great! Below are some candid photos of our cast & creative team:
Producer David Geha with Paula Abdul and Extra's, Terri Seymour

 Emmy winning producer Steve Sunshine on the red carpet 
Other Ways You Can Help..... 


We understand that you may not be able to donate, but there are other ways you can help us.  Our website tells our story: how far we've come and what's still left to do.  Please share the link to this Indigogo page & "like" us on our Facebook Fan Page and you can now follow us on Twitter too @SerranoBroadway.  Indigogo makes it easy - just use the share tools!   
Thank you for your support, we can't do this without you!  


Our Author & Lyricist, Madeline Sunshine - with Maizie Sunshine!
Our composer, Robert Tepper
Jeff Rizzo our Musical Director
The beautiful 'Rosanna"

"The Dishy Tarts" - in rehearsal



Sing it Mama! Mama gives Rosanna a pep talk about "Bad Boys"




"Vinnie Pepperini" - The Bad Boy

Some Testimonials…...

"I was invited to see a very early staged reading of Serrano in Los Angeles and I loved it.  I knew leaving the theater that night that I had seen something very special.  The story is hilarious, the music is wonderful and the talented Joel Zwick has put together an amazing cast.  I can't wait to see it again."Greg Kinnear, Actor


"I was fortunate enough to see a staged reading of "Serrano."  I love musical theater and my wife and I left that night singing the songs and laughing at the lines! It’s a sure fire hit.” Mario Lopez - "Extra" Host, ActorLive from the Emmys - "Extra" Producer, Omar Lugones, on why you will love "Serrano" ....."It's the most fun you'll have with your clothes on!"Terri Seymour, TV Correspondent and Host of "Extra" shares her love of "Serrano""I had the great fortune of watching a staged reading of Serrano and, wow, I am so happy I was invited to do so…the writing was entertaining and very funny, but also very sweet, with lots of great music and songs.  I am a person who likes to sit down whenever possible, especially since I am on my feet most of the day, but this was standing room only for me and I enjoyed every minute of it!"  Christine Norton, RN

"Extra," Below, we asked an audience member leaving "Serrano" what she thought of the staged reading and she was happy to tell us!

 Why writer/director, Brian Herzlinger wants to support "Serrano"





Risk:  There are always risks and challenges with any project.  However, we can't foresee any that would prevent SERRANO, the new musical comedy, from playing at The Matrix Theatre in Los Angeles in January if we raise our goal!

story:
Welcome to our Indiegogo Page!!

We are  Blue Shirt Productions and we are asking for Your Help to make our first  project possible! 
We are  staging William Shakespeare's Othello, at the Secret Theater in Queens from  October  22- 25. A total of 5 shows!  In order to make this project a reality, we are in desperate need of your support.  We are a group of theatre professionals in possession of degrees ranging from BFA to MA and MFA 's in Theater and Acting.  We are driven, qualified, and prepared to put on a great show! Unfortunately, the cost of living in New York City, partnered with the student debt many of us have from our educations, has  forced our  theatre work to be postponed in an effort to stay afloat financially. 
Every single one of us works full time at at least one job, so we are not asking for life support, we are asking for  DREAM support. Your contributions will allow us to stage a production, yes, but it will also allow us to continue our artistic adventure without fear of not being able to pay rent or buy groceries. Your help puts us on a path toward a career doing what we love, and for that we would be forever grateful. 

Where is the money going?

Great question internet!
- The bulk of our fundraising is to cover the cost of our venue. The Secret Theatre has been so generous with us,  and we are thrilled to be working with them.  The cost for the space for 1 week ( which covers tech rehearsals and 5 shows) is $2,100.
- After the venue cost, everything raised will be taking production costs away from the cast and crew.  Additional costs we hope to cover  include:
  • Prop Costs and Rentals ( daggers, bed linens, etc)
  • Set pieces (multifunctional set cubes, drapery, etc)
  • Printed Materials ( show program, postcards and posters for advertising)
  • Costume pieces ( actors may provide much of their costume, available funds will be used for supplemental materials.)
  • Cost of fundraising  (taxes and fees from Indiegogo and Paypal
For your help we are thrilled to offer an array of perks and thank you's to partially express our deep gratitude for your support of our project.
In the event we are able to pay for all of these expenses and have money left over (what even!?) the extra funds will be placed in a group account and this, in addition to ticket sale proceeds, will go to fund future productions. 
So please think of your contribution as an investment in good theatre, and artist growth!

But I'm broke, too!

No problem! While we appreciate even  $1  donations, if you simply don't have it and still want to help, we understand!
Please share our campaign link with family and friends. Share on all social media platforms! Tweet it! Gram it! Post it! Link it! Paint it on your forehead! We aren't picky! 
Please just spread the word! And when the time comes, we hope we will be able to see you in the audience! 
Thanks for everything guys! We love you!
Best, 
Elsbeth

story:
Tonic Theater Company - Darwin at Down

Our Story

Where We're Coming From: Kurt Elftmann: I'm artistic director and co-founder of Tonic Theater Company www.tonictheater.org. I’ve been a performer all my life acting in classics from Sophocles to Shakespeare to Tennessee Williams and along the way I’ve had the privilege of being a part of some really fine ensemble companies. However what I’ve come to enjoy most is helping to develop new plays. I realized that I wanted to build a theater company that would develop and produce new plays about history and science. Named after a favorite hangout in DC, over the past two years, Tonic Theater Company has produced readings of new plays around Washington, DC, including at the 2014 Kennedy Center Page-to Stage Festival. This year Tonic continues its free public readings, including at least one reading in partnership with the National Academy of Sciences (NAS). In January 2015 Tonic Theater Company participated in a discussion at the NAS to identify areas where the National Academy of Sciences could support, encourage and/or facilitate the development and production of theater that focuses on science themes, scientists, and the role of science in society. Now it's time for Tonic's first production.

Why a Campaign? Whether people know it or not they're hungry for stories about history and science. Many movies, TV shows and Broadway plays are based on actual events which the authors use as a springboard to present their story. Hollywood wants science in movies so much that our friends at the National Academy of Sciences started The Science & Entertainment Exchange just to help Tinseltown with its science. Tonic Theater Company will produce rich and entertaining new plays that increase public understanding of history and science, but we need your help. Darwin at Down, our first production, is vitally important to us as a means of introducing ourselves to several communities in the Washington, DC area, including the scientific and theater communities. It will also be the first opportunity for several institutions that may fund or support Tonic Theater Company to see our work, that's why we need your help. We need every single penny of our $10,000 budget to take this all-important first step. Once taken, Tonic Theater Company will be off and running. 

What We Can Build Together: Darwin at Down is Tonic Theater Company's first production but it won't be our last. With your help we can build a company that produces great new plays about history and science. Already we're gearing up for our second production as part of the Women's Voices Theater Festival in Washington, DC, and we'll continue to produce free readings around DC to increase our audience reach. The best way to spread our message is by showing audiences what we do best, live theater. You're help is vital to us. By donating to Tonic today you're also laying a solid foundation for our future.

Our Show: Darwin at Down, by Gino DiIorio, paints an intimate portrait of the conflict between Charles Darwin and his deeply religious wife Emma over Charles's decision to publish his theory of evolution in On the Origin of Species. It may not have been the first conflict in the evolution versus creation debate but it is perhaps the most significant.

Our Creative Team:

Director: Gillian Drake                                                                                                        Playwright: Gino DiIorio                                                                                                                  Cast:                                                                                                                                                         Joseph Hooker: Nick DePinto                                                                                                Charles Darwin: Kurt Elftmann                                                                                             Emma Darwin: TBA                                                                                                                        Ann Darwin: TBA

Opening: Fall 2015

What We Need & What You Get

Location. Location! Location? Rehearsal and performance spaces in Washington, DC are expensive and we also need to pay all the artists that come together to work on the show and make it happen. To realize our first production Tonic needs to raise $10,000. $2400 of this is already committed to our performance space at the District of Columbia Arts Center (DCAC) and nearly a like amount will be set aside for rehearsal space (this doesn't come free with a theater space). With nearly $4800 already accounted for, we still need to consider costumes, props, our minimal set and publicity, as well as paying everyone who makes the show happen.The pay for our designer team, actors and crew will be very modest, considering we will rehearse for three weeks and perform for three more, but everyone involved is dedicated to making Darwin at Down a success. It's very much a labor of love.

The Show Must Go On: While Tonic can still manage to produce Darwin at Down for less than $10,000, we would prefer that we don't have to. We want to give Gino DiIorio's play the highest production values we can right now. Your donations will help make that happen. And if we raise more than $10,000, every bit of it will go into making what promises to be a strong production shine even more. 

Thanking You: How to thank and reward people for helping fund Darwin at Down has been on our minds a lot. We have some very show-specific and Tonic-specific rewards for you, ranging from thanks on Tonic Theater Company's website, to Tonic coffee mugs or martini glasses, a special edition of the Darwin at Down script, access to open rehearsals, tickets to the show, and special behind the scenes interviews and footage.


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for considering Tonic Theater Company's campaign to fund Darwin at Down. If you can't donate right now you can still help. Please spread the word about our campaign by sharing with family and friends and on social media. If you like what Tonic is about and what we're doing, whether you donate or not, talk up our campaign. And remember you can always use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for all your help!

Kurt Elftmann

Tonic Theater Company

www.tonictheater.org
