story:
Fecal Matters

The People’s Own Organic Power Project (www.thePOOPproject.org) is on a mission to heal the cultural shame that makes potty talk taboo. This August, we’ll be asking unsuspecting audience members to Eat $h*t at the Edinburgh International Fringe Festival, the world’s largest and most diverse arts festival. This urgent one-man show gets people asking questions like:

  • Why aren’t we talking about an international sanitation crisis that kills a child every twenty seconds, when we could be investing in sustainable solutions that promote health and prosperity?
  • Why should we accept a world that makes us feel guilty for doing something everyone does, when we could be creating one that is hospitable to our whole bodies and their needs?
  • Why is our worth measured solely by how much we consume, when the “waste” we flush into our drinking water could be fertilizing our fields and fueling our cities?

Give A $h*t

The POOP Project has been accepted to premiere a new one-man show, Eat $h*t: How Our Waste Can Save the World, at the prestigious Edinburgh International Fringe Festival in August 2012. It’s an opportunity to reach over 1,500 audience members, plus thousands more who unwittingly step in our $h*t while attending. WTE Theatre has signed on to produce, and we’re partnering with the World Toilet Organization, Rose George, author of The Big Necessity, and others to bring sanitation center stage at the world’s largest arts festival. But first we need to get there.

By funding this show, you will be exposing a critical, unseen issue to a diverse audience with the power to spread this message around the world. A premiere in this distinguished festival offers us access to international media, reviews and audience buzz that can help catapult the show's reach well past August 2011. By December, you could Eat $h*t in a town near you!

Your contri-poo-tions will help us cover our a$$. The more the merrier!

The Bare Minimum: $9,000 / £5,700
Performance Space – Fringe Entry Fee – Insurance – Postcards – Posters – Housing (5 Poopers, 1 Month)

A Pot to P*ss In: $5,000 / £3,150
Advertisement in Fringe Bulletin – Costumes and Props – Rehearsal Space – Branded Giveaways – Additional PR

Toilet Paper Upgrade: $5,250 / £3,300 (costs otherwise borne by participants)
Travel Costs for Performers, Stage Managers and Director – Daily Expenses

Flush with Joy: $4,000 / £2,500 (costs otherwise borne by participants)
Author and Director Fees – Additional Advertising and Web Content

Get Cool $h*t

Everytime you feed the piggy bank, you'll get cool $h*t in return. Find our perks on the right, from poop paper to proud pooper stickers, cute pet poos and farm-to-flush dinner parties. For only $40, you can Eat $h*t again and again from the comfort of your home with the Edinburgh production DVD! Remember that your gift is tax-deductible to the full extent of the law through our fiscal sponsor, Fractured Atlas.

Help Us Make a Stink

This is a message for everybody and every body. Help us spread the word on Facebook, Twitter and Google+. Email that link to your fellow poopers! Get on the phone! Put a message in a bottle! Every little push helps.

Wipe Away Ignorance

Learn more about the global sanitation crisis. You might start by checking out the World Toilet Organization, UNICEF, or the Water Supply & Sanitation Collaborative Council. For some quick statistics, take a look at WaterAid and these UN graphs and maps. Check out Rose George’s The Big Necessity, watch Vanguard's full-length documentary World Toilet Crisis or the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation's short animation.

Learn more about sustainable toilets. Take a look at Joseph Jefferson's classic work on the Humanure Handbook, see what's happening over at Natural Event, and view some great educational posters over at Cloacina. You might also want to read about Friedensreich Hundertwasser's philosophes, or check out Gene Logsdon's Holy Shit: Managing Manure to Save Mankind.

Learn more about how toilets affect our lives. Join those fighting for better public loos at PHLUSH, the British Toilet Association or the American Restroom Association.  Check out Bog Standard or Project CLEAN to get the scoop on the sorry state of most school toilets. Read Dave Praeger's Poop Culture to understand the origins of "shameful sh*tting," and go behind the stall with the recent sociology collection Toilet: Public Restrooms and the Politics of Sharing.

Who Are You People?

The POOP Project is a grass-roots organization pushing for change from the bottom up. Created by Shawn "The Puru" Shafner in April 2010, we've since performed theatrical work at over a dozen venues around NYC, engaged people of all ages in educational experiences at environmental fairs, schools and religious institution, and spread the word through social media and at www.thePOOPproject.org. Our ongoing work includes a partnership with the Visitor Center at Newtown Creek, site of NYC’s largest wastewater treatment plant, and programs everywhere from the Children's Museum of Manhattan to the Denver Zoo. (You can see a full record of our activities HERE.)

story:
FEMALE DOG PRODUCTIONS is committed to cultivating the creative voice of women through all forms of visual media.  Writers and Producers, Datra Martindale and Kim Williams, formed the company in 2010.  Between the two of them, Martindale and Williams have established backgrounds in the creative fields of music, magazines, books, television and film. 

The first project of the company is in the theatrical arena with a riveting and emotional production.  BITCH is a series of monologues, based on real experiences, that exposes the different meanings and emotions of the word.  The collection of stories reveal how the popular five-letter word can evoke a range of emotions including, embarrassment, empowerment, vindication and belittlement.

Sept 17, 2010 marked the debut of BITCH at the El Centro Theater in Los Angeles, with 4 sold-out shows!  In 2012, BITCH made its NYC debut at Le Poisson Rouge and received raved reviews!

The long-term vision is to create a BITCH brand through, merchandising, community programs and both commercial and non-profitable productions of the play!  In order to get to our long term goal, we will need your help in raising funds to extend our production.  A three week run will give the exposure that we need to start a BITCH movement. So please, HELP A BITCH OUT!

story:
Play Synopsis 

With the decolonisation of Cyprus in 1960 came the democratisation of property-ownership, albeit with a slight risk. Yet, half a century after the last gasps of the British Empire, the Englishman’s house is still his castle, at home or away. Set in Kerynia during the three days of the 2004 Anan referendum in Cyprus a Slight Risk examines the latent conflicts camouflaged in the psyches of an apparently trouble-free British couple that moved to Northern Cyprus to spend the rest of their lives in a place by the sea and under the sun.

This acutely researched play exposes the strong ties of the English with their home and property-ownership. Bursting open the clichés of the moneyed, tanned middle-aged, ex-pat A Slight Risk unravels the exploitative relationships and the politics hiding in the brick and mortar of a house in the northern part of Cyprus forcing not only a change of address, but a crumbling demolition of desires and expectations. And whereas the immediate cracks are caused by an unexpected visit, human rights violations and Cyprus-problem politics, the echoes of A Slight Risk register the contemporary tremors of the revenging financial disasters.

 

The Impact

The play is inpired by the infamous Orams case: 

In 1974, Meletios Apostolides, an architect, was displaced with his family from his property in Lapithos as a result of the partition of Cyprus which followed a Greek Cypriot coup and the subsequent Turkish invasion of Cyprus.

In 2002, David Charles and Linda Elizabeth Orams, from Hove, Sussex, England, invested £160,000 of their retirement fund to acquire the land from a third party and to construct a villa on the premises. The third party claimed to have acquired the property from the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus (TRNC), a de facto state which, to this day, has not been recognised by any state except the Republic of Turkey. The Orams used the property in Northern Cyprus for vacations and maintained a separate property in the UK.

In 2003, the de facto administration of Northern Cyprus eased crossing restrictions along the ceasefire line giving the opportunity to displaced Cypriots to visit their old properties. Meletios Apostolides visited his property and confirmed the construction of the house occupied by the Orams. He then sued the Orams (represented in the English courts by Cherie Blair) and won the case.

Nevertheless - what makes one call a place 'home'?

 

Fresh Target Theatre Ensemble 

Fresh Target Theatre Ensemble aims to create a new and innovative theatre that is based in Athens but has the ability to produce plays in Cyprus and the UK drawing on respective contacts in these countries. 

Our philosophy is to engage with professionals from a number of different disciplines – disciplines which may not belong traditionally to the craft of making theatre (architects, graphic designers, sound engineers, fine and visual artists, etc). We believe that such an approach can only benefit the creative process and open new gateways as to what theatre is and can achieve.
 
We are also very keen on making our team a reference point for international artistic cooperation between artists/companies from Cyprus, Greece and the United Kingdom.
We want to create a total theatrical experience that immerses the audience in the world of the play paying as much attention on the space and the audience as to the performers and the text.
 
We aspire for a theatre:
  • that is connected with public issues;
  • that constitutes a common experience for actors and audience alike. 
 
Borrowing from Bertolt Brecht: ‘A theatre which makes no connection with the public is a nonsense. And anyone who fails to have fun out of his activities cannot expect them to be fun for anybody else’.
 

Awards

Cyprus National Theatre Awards 2012 - The Lead Actor of New World Order 2 (H.Pinter), Antonis Katsaris, received the best male actor award for the role of Nicholas 

What We Need & What You Get

$30
Reward 1

A copy of the original script signed by the writer. Also, a copy of the DVD of the performance signed by the director.

$50
Reward 2

All of the above plus a cup with the name of the performance signed by the whole cast.

$250
Reward 3

All of the above, plus plus extra backstage footage, photos and interviews from the cast.

$1,000
Reward 4

All of the above, plus adding yourself or company as patrons in the official show's programme. Also you get four (4) complimentary tickets to the show with access to the after-party event.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't forget to make some noise about our campaign.

Come on, use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Thank you,

Fresh Target Theatre Ensemble

In 1974, Meletios Apostolides, an architect, was displaced with his family from his property in Lapithos as a result of the partition of Cyprus which followed a Greek Cypriot coup and the subsequent Turkish invasion of Cyprus.
In 2002, David Charles and Linda Elizabeth Orams, from Hove, Sussex, England, invested £160,000 of their retirement fund to acquire the land from a third party and to construct a villa on the premises. The third party claimed to have acquired the property from the Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus (TRNC), a de facto state which, to this day, has not been recognised by any state except the Republic of Turkey. The Orams used the property in Northern Cyprus for vacations and maintained a separate property in the UK.
In 2003, the de facto administration of Northern Cyprus eased crossing restrictions along the ceasefire line giving the opportunity to displaced Cypriots to visit their old properties. Meletios Apostolides visited his property and confirmed the construction of the house occupied by the Orams. He then sued the Orams (represented in the English courts by Cherie Blair) and won the case.
Nevertheless - what makes one call a place 'home'?

 
Fresh Target Theatre Ensemble 
Fresh Target Theatre Ensemble aims to create a new and innovative theatre that is based in Athens but has the ability to produce plays in Cyprus and the UK drawing on respective contacts in these countries. 
Our philosophy is to engage with professionals from a number of different disciplines – disciplines which may not belong traditionally to the craft of making theatre (architects, graphic designers, sound engineers, fine and visual artists, etc). We believe that such an approach can only benefit the creative process and open new gateways as to what theatre is and can achieve.
 
We are also very keen on making our team a reference point for international artistic cooperation between artists/companies from Cyprus, Greece and the United Kingdom.We want to create a total theatrical experience that immerses the audience in the world of the play paying as much attention on the space and the audience as to the performers and the text.
 
We aspire for a theatre:

that is connected with public issues;
that constitutes a common experience for actors and audience alike. 


 
Borrowing from Bertolt Brecht: ‘A theatre which makes no connection with the public is a nonsense. And anyone who fails to have fun out of his activities cannot expect them to be fun for anybody else’.
 

Awards
Cyprus National Theatre Awards 2012 - The Lead Actor of New World Order 2 (H.Pinter), Antonis Katsaris, received the best male actor award for the role of Nicholas 


What We Need & What You Get
$30
Reward 1
A copy of the original script signed by the writer. Also, a copy of the DVD of the performance signed by the director.
$50
Reward 2
All of the above plus a cup with the name of the performance signed by the whole cast.
$250
Reward 3
All of the above, plus plus extra backstage footage, photos and interviews from the cast.
$1,000
Reward 4
All of the above, plus adding yourself or company as patrons in the official show's programme. Also you get four (4) complimentary tickets to the show with access to the after-party event.


Other Ways You Can Help


Don't forget to make some noise about our campaign.
Come on, use the Indiegogo share tools!
 
Thank you,
Fresh Target Theatre Ensemble

story:
Our Story Ashton is a 9 year old boy with a BIG dream.  He wants to be a FAMOUS BALLET Danseur.  His Dad is active duty enlisted in the Navy.  Because we have to move every three years it is very difficult to give him a stable childhood.  The one thing that we try to do is provide him with after school dance. It's very expensive,with gas prices,costume fees,ballet slippers etc...When he attends his classes it seems to help him cope with multiple deployments. He can express himself and relieve stress.  This year he has a scholarship  for summer training. The school is eight hours from our home.The school is paid for but the cost of the transportation,hotel,shoes and clothes required is just out of our reach. The school is the two weeks before we have to move again to a different state. I am creating this page to ask for help. We are a proud military family but his dream comes first. He has endured all of the teasing,bullying. We are so happy he is strong enough to follow his dream.Please help! 

(Introduce yourself and tell your campaign's story. Make sure to cover the who, what, where, when and how of your campaign.)


The Impact I know dance seems like something he could live without but I think it is vital. He really loves to perform and make other people smile. I fear if we couldn't make this happen for him that he will loose his passion. His father will deploy again (#5 in 7 yrs)later this year and I hope dance would distract him a bit. 

(What is the impact your campaign may have on others? What if your campaign doesn't happen, what are the consequences? Make it real for people.)


What We Need & What You Get If he doesn't reach his goal for this trip the money raised will go to finding him training in our new state. The new schools have application fees and tuition. Not every state or school is not for profit. Most dance academies are in it for the money.

(Break it down for folks - how much money do you need and where is it going? Be transparent and specific and be sure to address where the money goes if you don't reach your entire goal. For example, do you have other funding sources? Does part of the campaign still happen? Ensure people they are not just buying you dinner. Use this area to tell people about your unique perks, too!)


Other Ways You Can Help Please share his story with friends!

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

story:
Who Are You?

No Tea Productions (www.NoTeaProductions.com) is a five-year-old independent theater company in New York City. We are producing a brand new, original multimedia comedy--our 10th show!--and we desperately need help with the production costs.

What Is This?

The show is called SPACE CAPTAIN: Captain of Space! It's running late August-mid September at the Kraine Theater in NYC, with shows at 8:00 p.m. on August 30 & 31 and September 1, 6, 7, 13, 14, & 15.

No Tea's shows have been growing in size and scope since we started, and this is our biggest and funnest (yes, funnest!) show yet. SPACE CAPTAIN is set in the world of adventure stories from the 1930's like Flash Gordon and Buck Rogers, and the show is a mash-up of live performance, film, and puppetry. The story takes place on three different planets and an asteroid, and the performers include human actors, alien puppets, miniature spaceships, and a cat. Plus, the entire thing (including the live portions) is completely black and white. So we're facing some massive production costs--but we think it will be worth it.

Why Would I Want To Donate?

We've never asked for help before; we've always funded everything out of our own pockets, because we love working with our amazing company members and we think producing good, original, independent comedy is important and worth it. We always hope to break even, but as many indie theater producers know, it just doesn't happen. Any fully-produced play is expensive, and for shows that only run for 3 weeks in a small space, it is basically impossible to even come close to recouping the production costs.

You will be supporting us, you'll be supporting off-off-Broadway theater, but more importantly, you'll be supporting good original comedy, and we think that's worth paying for. We hope you do too.

Okay, What Exactly Am I Paying For?

Rising costs for rehearsal and performance spaces are our main expenses. We also need funds for the set, costumes, and props (and because this is a sci-fi period piece, those costs are considerable), as well as one day of filming in a greenscreen studio. We are hoping for $2500 to offset our losses. That is only a portion of what we'll actually spend on the show, but it will be enough to: (1) help us not go bankrupt, and (2) ensure that the stage won't be bare and the actors won't be naked.

And What Do I Get?

You get the smug sense of satisfaction and importance that only results from supporting independent theater! You can also get the cool stuff listed in the Perks section, on the side of the page there. You might walk away with a really awesome ship model, or even a T-SHIRT!

I Can't Help, But...

I'm Going to Tell My Friend(s)! Please do! Getting the word out helps us immensely. Please please please share the campaign on your social medium of choice.

I Want to See the Show! Well good, because attending the show helps too! Please visit http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/261910 for tickets, or go to www.NoTeaProductions.com and sign up on our mailing list for discounted tickets.

story:
SLAMHAIN IV: THE BRAWL OF THE WILD

Party World Rasslin' is a seasonal party and bizarre wrestling spectacle. At our last event, your support helped us resurrect REAL DINOSAURS. A cruel surfer was defeated by an unfrozen colonial woman, and we cried together with true joy. We learned that, through the magic of PARTY VIOLENCE, EVERYONE  can reclaim their lost past, even earth itself!

PWR now prepares for our 13th Party! Lucky 13... Thanks to you—the MULTIVERSE—PWR has  become something far beyond what we ever could have imagined. In 3 years we've gone from a handful of people watching a home-made ring with clip-on work lamps to attendance of a thousand+ and a full spectrum of professional audio, video and lighting. And we've built almost all of it ourselves, thanks to you! We continue to do a DIY show that is all-ages and free to the public, even as costs increase. Your continued support allows our core ethos to flourish. It means so much to us. The show remains FREE TO ATTEND, even as we mount mammoth costs. Here's what we want to do for our next show.


The Special Time of Year

Every PWR show is more insane and intense than the last, we've been to the UNDERGROUND ICE CAVES, surived the ROBOT APOCAYLPSE, and traded blows with REANIMATED DINOSAURS. Our FALL shows always hold a special place in our hearts. It's NEVER too early to celebrate Halloween - and that's just what we're doing! So what have we got??

How about an EXTREMELY HAUNTED FOREST?!

Twisted branches and vines - witches running rampant- giant trees with ancient, gnarled faces! Picture the orange, golds and greens of Autumn shaded by the char of dark sorcery! There's going to be extremely metal-looking satyrs, weird faeries, one single goblin engaged in forgotten rituals. It's Midsummer Night's Dream all mixed up with Myrkwood. It's going to be extremely creepy.

 And check this: the CURSED forest houses a CURSED ring! Legend has it that long ago, this forest was a peaceful, happy place. But then someone committed a horrible WRESTLECRIME and doomed the woods forever to eternal darkness! It is our sacred duty to wrestle hard in the dark woods -  to purify the ring and reclaim the forest for the forces of BABY WORM!

What powerful grapples shall we witness there? We'll tell you. A little background, on the competitors: Mrs. Fennenbaum is PWR's resident violent, disgraced elementary school teacher. She fled to the forest recently - muttering something about "night flyers" and "the coming power." She's been teaching class to forest creatures, rocks, and shrubs, all the while scrawling inscrutable symbols on the trees. What dark plans does she have?! The PARTYWEIGHT CHAMPION, Theodosia, is hot on her trail. Theodosia, the unfrozen colonial woman, has kicked plenty of ass. But she's never gotten...an education! Now she's challenging Mrs. F to a HIGH SCHOOL EQUIVALENCY MATCH! The belt is on the line! This is how GEDs work, in the haunted forest.

Our roster of PARTY ATHLETES will compete in distinctly FOREST ORIENTED challenges! Luigi Primo vs. Big Daddy Bolero in a LUMBERJACK MATCH...Spooky campfire stories with the NARRC...a Camping Trip with Dadbod...plus appearances by Pink Eye and the Dumpster Babes, Dan "the Man" Ziglar, Chubby Uncle Juan and Puggin'Head, Randy Eagleman!!! HAIL BABY WORM!

Our Fall shows have been some of our favorites. We're going to go totally crazy with the art. Even now, 4th Tap Brewing Co-Op is becoming a fecund, magical cursed forest! Imposing, scowling trees, bioluminescent moss, weird, corrupted forest creatures, abandoned spiderwebs, witchlights and foxfires!

What is this money used for?

$5000 is a lot of money! What’s it going toward?

First, an important recitation: PWR is free and we want to keep it free. PWR is for everyone, even if they can't afford to pay cover at a show. We'd like to keep from having to charge admission for as long as we can.

PWR is also now a 80-person organization putting on a show for 1500 people. One and a half thundo! Increased expectations beget increased (and wholly worthwhile) costs: we spent north of $9000, each, to produce our last 2 shows.

Through diligent saving and prudent investment, we've managed to cap our fundraising goal at ~$5000, depending on the season. We are continuously able to improve the show and make it grander; your support and our rigorous planning have allowed us to do this without ballooning our costs! And it's all on the backs of our beautiful volunteers who submit themselves to the Multiverse out of love. We've survived more than two years as we've grown into the massive wrestling party you know today—and we're not slowing down! Accept no impostors! HELL RIGHT

Some of the cool things your donations have let us do include:

  • Cooling. We don't want the heat of summer to discourage people from engaging in Party Violence.  We've got a new plan that will CRUSH the humidity and heat - we're retooling our space for maximum airflow! Part of our plan includes installing is a huge, $700 fan. Our new cooling plan will draw a lot of power, as well, so we're going to get a generator to make sure our electrical system is protected.

  • Art and design. We have an extremely talented team of designers who transform the venue into an art piece by using garbage. 4th Tap was turned into a PLUSH DINOTOPIA by their selfless, capable hands. The HAUNTED MEGAFOREST they're building will suck you into the world of SLAMHAIN! Though most of our resources are scavenged from trash bins and thrift stores, filling a venue of our size with cool decorations—and the storage to keep them preserved show after show!—costs money.

  • Safe space/security: PWR is a party for everyone. Our performers have always followed anti-sexist/homophobic/transphobic/racist guidelines, and we wanted to make sure that comfort extends to our audience. We’re proud of our security phone line. Any member of the audience may use this number to report gross behavior at the show, and we resolve the problem, no questions asked. Your support lets us keep reaching toward a goal of ULTIMATE PARTY VIOLENCE for everyone.

  • Paying artists. We work hard to make sure everyone who contributes to our production gets some money in exchange—whether our art team, our powerful tech wizards, or our A/V crew.

  • Projection and lighting. This might be a dark forest, but you'll see everything with crystal-clarity! PWR has some of the most advanced lighting for an independent wrestling show in the country! And we built it ourselves, with your help. We still have improvements to make; you'll notice and love our latest generation of lights! Our projection system allows people to watch the show from 3 different places in the venue, each with different sitting and standing options!

  • Training: Party Violence is its own unique sport. We have crafted a training program that makes use of experienced pro-wrestling coaching to help keep our PARTY ATHLETES smooth n' safe.  

For transparency: this Indiegogo doesn’t cover all of adolescent PWR’s expenses, but it takes care of a majority of them. Below is our complete budget.

Show Expenses: $2735

Props: $250
Art: $550
Staff Food: $80

Live Video Projection: $200
Promo Material $100
Security: $160
Insurance: $385
Printing: $150
Construction: $110
Cooling: $500
PA: $225

Operational Expenses: $3000

Artist and staff pay: $2600
New Projects Capital : $400

Indiegogo Reward production and fulfillment: $1854
Indiegogo and credit card fees: $394.65

Extremely Hype Swag


Whoa!!! If you donate, you'll get some great perks! Including an exclusive T-shirt that you can only get from this indiegogo campaign!

Here's the EXCLUSIVE new T-shirt by Zeke Guadiana! Get it in black or autumnal maroon, unisex tee, lady's cut tee, or tank top styles!



Colors may vary slightly.

Need something for  your WALL? Check out this POSTER by Zeke, too! It tells the story of HAUNTED FOREST WRESTLING...with Pictures! Yes...



Check out this EMBROIDERED PATCH by Ray McClellan!


Or how about...PINS! Nat Bradford produces these laser-cut, acrylic pins that honor the spirit and mission of PARTY VIOLENCE! Two different designs available:
Design 1:


Design 2:




And what's more: We've got PLUSHIES by C. James Donovan! Get these insanely soft versions of exciting PARTY ATHLETES!
It's PLUSHY PINKEYE!


And Plushy Luigi Primo!


Some other great rewards include VIP Balcony passes, pins, and more! Keep an eye on this space for more pictures!

Risks & Challenges

 

Challenges:

PWR has become robust and its universe swole with powerful party drama. As it continues to grow wantonly like an uncontrollable teen (and our expectations for our performance climb) we approach a new realm of costs we could not have imagined before.  We are depending on the support of our Multiverse to keep our show free and open—thank you for your continued support.  Rest assured we are working night and day to make sure this event is the most fun thing you do all quarter.

 

Risks:

The only risk is the risk of not partying hard enough. We laugh at the concept of "risk." It is as outmoded as "shame," or "weakness." We have sworn to party 'til death, and we will do so.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't want to donate money you can help us by getting the word out about this campaign and/or just word out about PWR and SLAMHAIN!


Here is the Facebook event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/1880748745520219/

HMW

Two different designs available:Design 1:Design 2:And what's more: We've got PLUSHIES by C. James Donovan! Get these insanely soft versions of exciting PARTY ATHLETES!It's PLUSHY PINKEYE!And Plushy Luigi Primo!Some other great rewards include VIP Balcony passes, pins, and more! Keep an eye on this space for more pictures!
Risks & Challenges
 Challenges:PWR has become robust and its universe swole with powerful party drama. As it continues to grow wantonly like an uncontrollable teen (and our expectations for our performance climb) we approach a new realm of costs we could not have imagined before.  We are depending on the support of our Multiverse to keep our show free and open—thank you for your continued support.  Rest assured we are working night and day to make sure this event is the most fun thing you do all quarter. Risks:The only risk is the risk of not partying hard enough. We laugh at the concept of "risk." It is as outmoded as "shame," or "weakness." We have sworn to party 'til death, and we will do so.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you don't want to donate money you can help us by getting the word out about this campaign and/or just word out about PWR and SLAMHAIN!Here is the Facebook event page: https://www.facebook.com/events/1880748745520219/HMW

story: A multi-dimensional neo-absurdist play, The Wind Cries Mary questions the confines of reality, memory, and death through a queer, disabled lens.
story_txt: A multi-dimensional neo-absurdist play, The Wind Cries Mary questions the confines of reality, memory, and death through a queer, disabled lens.

story:
Our Play’s The Thing

is a concentrated two-week, community-based theater program which offers older adults age 60 and up who live in Queens the opportunity to create an original 30 to 40 minute play. The inspiration for the play will be a physical object such as flowers, keys, or shoes. The group will investigate their associations to the object through activities like storytelling, improvisation and reflection to create scenes which incorporate the object as a thematic motif.  No prior theater experience is needed to participate. The project will culminate in a public performance held in the multi-purpose common room at Young Israel of Forest Hills Senior League in Forest Hills on Thursday, August 9 at 1:00 PM.

The program will support older adults to:

  • increase their social engagement  
  • acquire a sense of mastery of theater through sequential arts activities
  • promote both physical and mental health
  • stimulate enhanced memory by using a physical object as a tactile entry point
  • develop their critical thinking skills as they reflect on their work-in-progress.

What We Need and What You Get:

The program is offered free of charge to seniors 60 and up. Your support will enable us to cover the cost of:
  • Workshop supplies: paper, pencils, pens, markers, etc.
  • Costume pieces
  • Props
  • Scenery: a backdrop and set pieces
  • Printed programs and posters advertising the public event
  • Artist fees for workshop facilitators.

Check out the sidebar for the amazing perks that we are offering, which range from your name on our website ($10 donation) to a printed copy of a transcript of our original play ($200).  
 

Who is involved?

This project is an exciting collaboration between many people and organizations:
  • Adults age 60 and up living in Forest Hills, Queens will create and perform an original play
  • 2 theater artists, Kevin Ray and Sherry Teitelbaum, will develop and facilitate the theater workshops with seniors
  • Young Israel of Forest Hills Senior League will provide administrative and operational support
  • Everybody Act! Theater in Education & Communities will provide administrative and artistic support  
  • NYC community members, members of the senior center, and friends will attend the final event which is open to the public.
Only one thing is missing from the mix: YOU!

Other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign by clicking the Facebook “Like”, Twitter “Tweet”, or Google “Plus” buttons at the top of this page.
  • Join us at the public event on Thursday, August 9th at 1pm at Young Israel of Forest Hills Senior League, 68-07 Burns Street, Forest Hills, NY.

About Creative Aging

Creative Aging approaches aging in a new way. Rather than viewing the older years as a time of steady decline and deterioration, the new paradigm of creative aging reveals these years to be a time of discovery, integration, and growth. Older adults who engage in lifelong learning in a social setting have been shown to experience a powerful sense of mastery through acquiring new skills. This sense contributes to wellness by decreasing depression and slowing cognitive decline.  Gene Cohen’s landmark study, The Creativity and Aging Study: The Impact of Professionally Conducted Cultural Programs on Older Adults, found that when older adults enrolled in participatory arts programs at three different geographical sites in the United States were compared to a control group, they reported “(A) better health, fewer doctor visits, and less medication usage; (B) more positive responses on the mental health measures; (C) more involvement in overall activities.”

story:
Cara's Story

Hi! My name is Cara Maltz and it's actually true – my mom is a sex therapist! As you can imagine my childhood was a bit unusual at best and downright embarrassing at worst, like when I was in fifth grade and my mom was the featured speaker at Career Day...

This memory along with many others gave me a wealth of material to use as an artist. I am now a New York based actress, singer, dancer, writer, producer, and the real life inspiration behind the one-woman musical My Mom is a Sex Therapist.

The Show

My Mom is a Sex Therapist was conceived back in 2010 by the team of Gabi Hegan, producer, Stephan Varnier, writer and director, and Cara Maltz, Actress, Singer, Writer and Producer. We developed different versions of the show featuring an original title song by Keith Varney as well as various covers, and were invited to perform in several festivals and venues. Each version was a success and received positive reviews and feedback but we knew we eventually wanted a completely original show, from script to music. We went on a wild goose chase for the right composer and lyricist and found both in Joshua H. Cohen. He has since written 9 fabulous songs for us and Cara cannot wait to perform them in front of an audience.

The all original version of My Mom is a Sex Therapist will debut November 13th,16th, and 17th, 2013 at the Duplex Theatre in New York City. We hope to see you there!

Why we need your support

Needless to say, three years of dedicated hard work come with a hefty price tag and we now need your support to take the show to the next level. We truly believe My Mom is a Sex Therapist has potential to become a household name. It’s funny, it’s thoughtful, it’s personal and it has great songs that will stay with you even after you left the theater.


Here is what we need the funding for:

  • Amazing original music: $1000
  • Smashing new costumes: $500
  • Broadway level accompanist: $600
  • A professional website for the show: $1500+
  • Submissions to several festivals next year and future productions: $1000+

Rewards and Thank you's! 

We have some great rewards in store for your contributions. Get a signed postcard or program (your grandchildren will thank you some day!) custom condoms, fun T-Shirts and of course VIP packages for the show! 

My Mom is a Sex Therapist is funny, witty, even personal. And it answers questions you'd never dare to ask YOUR mom...

Closing Night After Party: Get tickets and free drinks to our closing night party on Sunday, November 17th after the show (exact location TBA). 

Thank you for your support.

BONUS: Listen to "My Mom is a Sex Therapist"


GET YOUR TICKETS HERE!


____________________________________________________________________

The Company:

Starring Cara Maltz - www.caramaltz.com

Written by Cara Maltz & Stephan Varnier

Directed by Stephan Varnier

Accompanied by Garrit Guadan - www.garritguadan.com

Music and Lyrics by Joshua H. Cohen - www.joshuahcohen.com

"My Mom is a Sex Therapist"  by Keith Varney

_______________________________

Costumes by Nicholas Hartman

Produced by Cara Maltz & Gabi Hegan

story:
What is Thrill The World Kigali?

Thrill The World is a world wide dance event in which groups of Zombies dance Michael Jackson’s iconic “Thriller” Choreography to raise money for charity, promote dance, spread love and joy to the community and honor the Humanitarian and Artistic efforts of Michael Jackson. All of this and an attempt to break the world record for largest simultaneous dance, which is currently held by Thrill The World!

 

It began in 2006 in Toronto, Canada and has now spread to 6 continents including Africa for the very first time this year! Each group hosting an event pays money to register, which goes to Thrill The World’s charity of choice. Each group then has the option to raise money for a charity of their choice. I have chosen a local children’s traditional dance group called: Inkondo Z’incamihigo (Small but Strong!)

 

 

Who will benefit from the event?

I met a local young man named Gilbert Rutaremara through a connection from Santa Barbara, when I was here with World Dance.  Gilbert is an orphan from the Genocide and has supported himself through his gift and talent for dance. He has been a member of the National Ballet for many years but is now in school to study Information Technology thanks to support from a family in the US. Gilbert teaches traditional dance to a group of 25 local boys and girls in Kacyiru called: Inkondo Z’incamihigo (Small but Strong!)

Meet Gilbert:

(Gilbert receiving the first 1000 RWF from practice sessions!)

Gilbert has a deep passion for dance and sees it as an important skill that has helped him survive. He feels that he can offer the same opportunity to the children in Kigali by sharing his gift with them. He began this dance group by going out into the streets in Kacyiru and dancing with whoever was drawn to him, this slowly evolved into a group that is ever expanding and shifting. He offers himself to anyone who is in need and who wants to begin to learn a skill that will help them to help themselves in their future.

The group practices 2-3 times a week wherever they can, usually in the middle of a broken down building and they perform at Hotels, Weddings and anywhere else they can.

Gilbert and I share the same ideals, to offer our skills as a support not as a way of helping them directly, there by offering opportunities to learn to help themselves reach their potential. We believe that fostering self-reliance through providing tools is the best way to build confidence and trust in oneself.


Meet Some Of The Dancers:

Name: Issa

Age: 13

Family: Mama, Papa, 1 brother, 3 sisters (all go to school)

School: Yes, Primary 4

Dreams: Wants to be a professional football player (soccer)

 


Name: Paster

Age:18

Family: Mama, 1 brother, 3 sisters (1 sister in school)

School: Yes, Primary 6

Dreams: wants to be a pastor



Name: Mohammed

Age: 19

Family: Mama, Papa, 4 brothers, 4 sisters (1 brother in school)

School: No, would be in Senior 1

Dreams: Wants to be a Slahe (spiritual leader of Muslim tradtion)



Name: Everiste

Age: 19

Family: Papa, 2 brothers, 1 sister

School: No, would be in Senior 6

Dreams: Wants to be a race car driver and an electrician

 


Name: Sady

Age: 15

Family: Mama, 3 Sisters, 3 brothers (all in school)

School: Yes, Primary 4

Dreams: Wants to be a mechanic and a driver



Name: Abdul

Age: 14

Family: Papa, Mama, 3 sisters, 3 brothers

School: Yes, Primary 5

Dreams: Wants to be a businessman with a landscaping company and a small shop.


What will the fundraising money support?

All the money raised through the dance practice sessions, fundraising and donations will go to the group to help them with whatever they need to keep them dancing. Some of the members have no parents, no home and no support while others have families, schooling and support systems. The money will be given to Gilbert for him to manage according to the needs of the group. Some examples of how the money will be used include: food, water, rent, clothing, school fees, dance practice space rental fees, costume rentals for performances.

 

For example: US Dollars

1 semester of school cost $35 (3 semesters per school year)

$1.50 can buy lunch or dinner for one person

$50 can pay rent for 1 month

$1 can buy a bunch of bananas

$2 can buy  4 mangos

$5 can buy a pair of shoes      

 

I witnessed the group process last week when I gave them 5000 RWF ($7.60 US) from the money already raised. They talked amongst themselves and came to an agreement as to who needed it the most in that moment and it was given out accordingly. My intention is not to impose any ideals onto the group. I feel that managing of the funds is also an important tool for learning. That being said, if we raise a large sum I will offer my knowledge of basic finances like how to open a bank account or find someone for Gilbert to be in communication with regarding money management. Gilbert will be in charge of financial distribution.

 

 

Why is this event important for Rwanda?

 

This event connects Rwanda to the entire world through the spirit of dance, love and joy, which I believe to be incredibly important to healing. It also brings awareness to the potential beyond the borders of Africa or even of the sector that they live in. The children know that it was a group in California that introduced me to the event and the reason I am here all the way from Canada. They have the opportunity to work with someone from another country, which makes it possible for them to believe that there is more out there than what they experience in their daily lives. It is a fact that they are part of a world wide event and are working with an international organization, which is an opportunity that a lot of children here may not experience or believe that they can be a part of.

This is the first year that Africa is involved in this event and I feel very honored to be able to introduce such a wonderful tool to this continent and this country. Let’s keep it going!

 

Why is this event important for the community?

 

Watching the faces of the children I dance with light up at even just the mention of Michael Jackson demonstrates to me that this work is having an impact in a positive way. The simple act of sharing a moment of joy and happiness can leave lasting imprints in our hearts and minds and if that is all that it does than it is enough.

 

 

What is the message you want to send by hosting this event?

My hope is that the spirit of Michael Jackson is conveyed through hosting this event. I am a huge fan and fully believe in his message of Love and giving back to others. I believe in following our hearts and using our natural talents to make change in the world. I would love for the kids involved to witness what they are capable of achieving when they commit to helping themselves. They are making changes in their lives by accepting the gifts that present themselves, however small. This fosters a belief in themselves, which will build on their self-worth and self-esteem. This event has the potential to change the course of their lives by changing their view of themselves and their place in the world.

 

                                             MEET THE HOST

                                    

My name is Amanda Emsland and I am from Canada. Nearly 3 ½ years ago I began a personal healing journey. I moved to an Ashram and began intensely studying Yoga as a way to heal myself from a nervous breakdown, Fibromyalgia, Major Depression, Bi Polar II disorder, extreme physical pain to the point of being unable to walk, failure to thrive (stopped eating), suicidal ideations and so much more. I did this for nearly 2 years and am now healthier than ever before. Through this experience I began to see life symbolically and I now use Michael Jackson as one of the main symbols to help guide me in my life.

 

In 2012, I followed many signs leading me to California. One day I was flipping through the paper and saw an ad for Thrill The World Santa Barbara, there he was and this was my first step towards coming to Rwanda.

 

The event was being hosted by a local dance group called “World Dance for Humanity.” It was with this dance group that I came to Rwanda in June, 2013 to meet the co-operatives members that we send all of our class fees and fundraising efforts to as support. The rest of the members left and I stayed behind not fully knowing what I was here to do but I knew I needed to stay and continue to follow my heart. After a few weeks it became clear I was here to host this event.

 

After participating in Thrill The World Santa Barbara I committed to hosting the event every year, wherever I happen to be living, so this year it is Kigali City! My intention is to have it continue on after my departure and I have made some great connections that will help make that possible but can always use a helping hand if anyone is interested. It is my goal to spread this event to as many different communities as I can because of the impact it had on my own life. I believe it has the potential to make real change. My next stop is Northern Manitoba, Canada!

 

The changes I have made to my life in order to heal are extreme and include selling all of my belongings, giving up my home, ending my engagement, quitting my career as a Registered Nurse, living on Faith and following my heart. Because of this I came to Rwanda with just enough money to last a few months and have nothing to go back to. I am here offering myself fully to the people and believe that what I am doing is having just as positive an impact on their lives as is does on mine. I am currently living off of my Visa and on a very tight budget.

 

I am hosting this event on my own, which is no easy task seeing as I knew only 1 person when I came and had to find dancers and teach them the dance, find practice space, advertise, market, promote, organize, find a venue, learn to use social media, and so much more, all in a foreign country with a huge language barrier! I am only saying all of this to emphasize my need for support.

 

I have set up my own campaign on which you can support my journey here in Rwanda. I am the reason the event is here, I am what will make it come together, I am holding all of the potential for this to be a great success and without a host there is no event. Please help me make this an event that can change the lives of a few wonderful and deserving children.

 

Ways to Donate To The Host:

1) www.indiegogo.com: I Am Love In Action

 

2) Donate or follow me on my Blog at: www.iamloveinaction.wordpress.com

 

“Healing Ourselves, Heals The World” 
I Am Love In Action, Amanda Emsland

 

What else can you tell us about he actual event?

 

The event will be held at Papyris on October 26th  at 11pm.

 

But the fun starts before then and continues into the night as the kids will arrive and be treated to a meal compliments of Papyris (thank you so much Serge for food and transport) and will be dancing and having fun listening to MJ in prep for the countdown to show time. 50% of the cover fee to the night club is being donated to the event so even if you can’t make the show you can support us by going out for a night at the club with your friends.

 

What can we do to help make this a success?

 

 

1)    Send a link to your friends and family and ask that they support this cause.

 

2)     Donate to Thrill The World Kigali

 

3)    Donate via my Blog: www.iamloveinaction.wordpress.com and click on “Donate” to keep the host and the event alive!

 

4)    Like “Thrill The World Kigali” on Facebook and share it with friends and family.

 

5)    Word of mouth is a very powerful tool so tell everyone and anyone about the event and create a BUZZ! We can feel your positive energy all the way in Rwanda!

 

6)    Host an event in your area!

 

7)    Learn The Dance on Youtube: Type in “Learn Thriller Dance” and start leaning in the comfort of your own home and join us on the day of the event. We go live at 9pm GMT, 11pm Kigali!

 

8)    Check out the Web page: www.Thrilltheworld.com and count down with us to Thrill Time

 

9)    Contact Amanda directly:

 

      By email: Thrilltheworldkigali@gmail.com

By phone: 078 939 3521

www.iamloveinaction.wordpress.com under “contact” info at the bottom of each post


                            Keep The Thrill Alive, Keep on Dancing!


 

Heal The World
Make It A Better Place
For You And For Me
And The Entire Human Race
There Are People Dying
If You Care Enough
For The Living
Make A Better Place
For You And For Me
 
                                        
“Heal The World”, Michael Jackson

$5 can buy a pair of shoes       
 

I witnessed the group process last week when I gave them
5000 RWF ($7.60 US) from the money already raised. They talked amongst
themselves and came to an agreement as to who needed it the most in that moment
and it was given out accordingly. My intention is not to impose any ideals onto
the group. I feel that managing of the funds is also an important tool for
learning. That being said, if we raise a large sum I will offer my knowledge of
basic finances like how to open a bank account or find someone for Gilbert to
be in communication with regarding money management. Gilbert will be in charge
of financial distribution. 
 

 
Why is this event
important for Rwanda?
 

This event connects Rwanda to the entire world through the
spirit of dance, love and joy, which I believe to be incredibly important to
healing. It also brings awareness to the potential beyond the borders of Africa
or even of the sector that they live in. The children know that it was a group
in California that introduced me to the event and the reason I am here all the
way from Canada. They have the opportunity to work with someone from another
country, which makes it possible for them to believe that there is more out
there than what they experience in their daily lives. It is a fact that they
are part of a world wide event and are working with an international
organization, which is an opportunity that a lot of children here may not
experience or believe that they can be a part of. 
This is the first year that Africa is involved in this event
and I feel very honored to be able to introduce such a wonderful tool to this
continent and this country. Let’s keep it going!
 

Why is this event
important for the community?
 

Watching the faces of the children I dance with light up at
even just the mention of Michael Jackson demonstrates to me that this work is
having an impact in a positive way. The simple act of sharing a moment of joy
and happiness can leave lasting imprints in our hearts and minds and if that is
all that it does than it is enough. 
 

 
What is the message you
want to send by hosting this event?
My hope is that the spirit of Michael Jackson is conveyed
through hosting this event. I am a huge fan and fully believe in his message of
Love and giving back to others. I believe in following our hearts and using our
natural talents to make change in the world. I would love for the kids involved
to witness what they are capable of achieving when they commit to helping
themselves. They are making changes in their lives by accepting the gifts that
present themselves, however small. This fosters a belief in themselves, which
will build on their self-worth and self-esteem. This event has the potential to
change the course of their lives by changing their view of themselves and their
place in the world. 

 

                                             MEET
THE HOST
                                    
My name is Amanda Emsland and I am from Canada. Nearly 3 ½
years ago I began a personal healing journey. I moved to an Ashram and began
intensely studying Yoga as a way to heal myself from a nervous breakdown,
Fibromyalgia, Major Depression, Bi Polar II disorder, extreme physical pain to the point of being unable to walk, failure to thrive (stopped eating), suicidal ideations and so much more. I did this
for nearly 2 years and am now healthier than ever before. Through this
experience I began to see life symbolically and I now use Michael Jackson as one
of the main symbols to help guide me in my life.
 

In 2012, I followed many signs leading me to California. One
day I was flipping through the paper and saw an ad for Thrill The World Santa
Barbara, there he was and this was my first step towards coming to Rwanda. 
 

The event was being hosted by a local dance group called
“World Dance for Humanity.” It was with this dance group that I came to Rwanda
in June, 2013 to meet the co-operatives members that we send all of our class
fees and fundraising efforts to as support. The rest of the members left and I
stayed behind not fully knowing what I was here to do but I knew I needed to
stay and continue to follow my heart. After a few weeks it became clear I was
here to host this event.
 

After participating in Thrill The World Santa Barbara I
committed to hosting the event every year, wherever I happen to be living, so
this year it is Kigali City! My intention is to have it continue on after my
departure and I have made some great connections that will help make that
possible but can always use a helping hand if anyone is interested. It is my
goal to spread this event to as many different communities as I can because of
the impact it had on my own life. I believe it has the potential to make real
change. My next stop is Northern Manitoba, Canada!
 

The changes I have made to my life in order to heal are
extreme and include selling all of my belongings, giving up my home, ending my
engagement, quitting my career as a Registered Nurse, living on Faith and
following my heart. Because of this I came to Rwanda with just enough money to
last a few months and have nothing to go back to. I am here offering myself
fully to the people and believe that what I am doing is having just as positive
an impact on their lives as is does on mine. I am currently living off of my
Visa and on a very tight budget. 
 

I am hosting this event on my own, which is no easy task
seeing as I knew only 1 person when I came and had to find dancers and teach
them the dance, find practice space, advertise, market, promote, organize, find
a venue, learn to use social media, and so much more, all in a foreign country
with a huge language barrier! I am only saying all of this to emphasize my need
for support. 
 

I have set up my own campaign on which you can support my
journey here in Rwanda. I am the reason the event
is here, I am what will make it come together, I am holding all of the
potential for this to be a great success and without a host there is no event.
Please help me make this an event that can change the lives of a few wonderful
and deserving children. 
 

Ways to Donate To The Host:
1) www.indiegogo.com: I
Am Love In Action
 

2) Donate or follow me on my Blog at: www.iamloveinaction.wordpress.com
 
“Healing Ourselves,
Heals The World” I Am Love In Action, Amanda Emsland


 
What else can you tell us
about he actual event?
 
The event will be held at Papyris on October 26th  at 11pm.
 

But the fun starts before then and continues into the night
as the kids will arrive and be treated to a meal compliments of Papyris (thank
you so much Serge for food and transport) and will be dancing and having fun
listening to MJ in prep for the countdown to show time. 50% of the cover fee to
the night club is being donated to the event so even if you can’t make the show
you can support us by going out for a night at the club with your friends.




 

What can we do to help
make this a success?
 

 

1)   
Send a link to your friends and family and ask that they
support this cause.

 

2)   
 Donate to Thrill
The World Kigali

 

3)   
Donate via my Blog: www.iamloveinaction.wordpress.com
and click on “Donate” to keep the host and the event alive!

 

4)   
Like “Thrill The World Kigali” on Facebook and share it with
friends and family.

 

5)   
Word of mouth is a very powerful tool so tell everyone and
anyone about the event and create a BUZZ! We can feel your positive energy all
the way in Rwanda!

 

6)   
Host an event in your area!
 

7)   
Learn The Dance on Youtube: Type in “Learn Thriller Dance” and
start leaning in the comfort of your own home and join us on the day of the
event. We go live at 9pm GMT, 11pm Kigali!

 

8)   
Check out the Web page: www.Thrilltheworld.com
and count down with us to Thrill Time

 

9)   
Contact Amanda directly:

 

      By email: Thrilltheworldkigali@gmail.com

By phone: 078 939 3521

www.iamloveinaction.wordpress.com
under “contact” info at the bottom of each post 


                            Keep The Thrill Alive, Keep on Dancing!




 


Heal The WorldMake It A Better PlaceFor You And For MeAnd The Entire Human RaceThere Are People DyingIf You Care EnoughFor The LivingMake A Better PlaceFor You And For Me                                         “Heal The World”,
Michael Jackson

story:
WOW! I could write that "we did it", but "You did it!"

We cannot thank you enough for getting us over the top. Any extra money we have will go towards purchasing a few more things, a blue ray option, automation, the ability to play films directly from computers (for local film makers) and more.


And now back to our pitch...

Hollywood is forcing cinemas to upgrade to expensive digital projection equipment or cease operation as 35mm film comes to an end.

Go Digital or...

For the past 100 years, movies have been printed on film. But technology marches on and film studios and disributors have announced that 35mm film will no longer be produced and will be replaced by digital files. It has been estimated that up to 20% of theaters across North America, representing up to 10,000 screens, may close because they will be unable to afford to upgrade. We're hoping that we won't be one of them.

Most people think of digital projection as being a digital projector and a DVD player of some kind. If only it was that easy. Anyone converting to digital projection will need:
DCI-Compliant 2K Digital Projector
Digital Cinema Media Server
Lenses and Bulbs

The cost for us is $30,000 to equip one screen (we were lucky enough to find a projector and server that was used for one week by a corporate client).

If we exceed our goal, any additional funds will be used to refurbish the furniture in the lobby, and upgrade our concession area. 

About The Brooklyn Heights Cinema Cinema

The Brooklyn Heights Cinema is located in Brooklyn Heights, NYC. When the Brooklyn Heights Cinema first opened it's doors in 1970, it was the only independent movie theater in Brownstone Brooklyn for many years. This theater has been my local theater ever since I was a child, and has continued to remain a huge part of my life since then. So 2 1/2 years ago, when the theater was on the verge of closing, I knew I needed to do something to keep the Brooklyn Heights Cinema alive. I maxed out all my credit cards and borrowed money from everyone I could to make it happen, and was finally able to save the Brooklyn Heights Cinema. While we've had a great run since then, the theater is facing one more major obstacle. 

We need your help because a theater this small cannot raise the money needed without the help of film lovers. I hope that as a movie lover you'll contribute to help keep the Brooklyn Heights Cinema in business. The luxury of a theater like ours is that our customers have a place they can go to see great new movies and be treated like a friend and family, and it would be an absolute tragedy to have to close our doors. We show independent films that you would never find at a multi-plex. Films like "The Place Beyond the Pines",  "In A World", "All Is Lost", "MUD", "Nebraska" and many more. We've shown films by local film makers who can't find any other cinemas in New York City to play their work. One film "Battle for Brooklyn" made the short list for best documentary film.

Besides showing movies we host a stand up comedy night, live music performances and silent films with live music. 

If we can't raise this money for a digital projector, we will be unable to play new films, and we will sadly lose the last, yes the last, locally owned independent movie theater in New York City.

How does indiegogo work? 
1. Our goal is to raise between $30,000 by the end of March 2014. 
2. You can help us reach our goal by making a pledge to donate and when you chip in, you get a reward. 
3. Any amount, no matter how small, helps get us closer to success. 

Your donation

We understand that donors have a financial stake in seeing this project succeed. From the time of purchase to installation could be as short as 2 weeks. We already have an installer ready to come in and set us up.

What if I can't make a donation? 
Whether or not you can donate, please help us by spreading the word! Send this link to your family, friends, colleagues, classmates, teachers, acquaintances. Post it on Facebook. Tweet about it and encourage others to do the same. Our campaign will only be as successful if we get the word out.

story:
Short Summary

Madd World Productions was born out of a desire to create and to tell stories. We are a grassroots theatre and film company with a hunger and thirst for producing content that pushes boundaries and leaves you questioning your very existence.

Our current project "Life Of The Party" is going to showcase at the Sydney Fringe Festival in September 2015 and we need your help to get us there.

The Life Of The Party cast and crew is made up of a bunch of passionate theatre loving thespians who strongly believe in advocating for the arts to make this Madd World we live in just that little bit more funner and crazier in a good way!!

This is a new play written by the vibrantly talented Mark Alan Lee. It tells the story of our protagonist, the loveable affable, Charlie a recent newlywed who just lost the love of his life, the vivacious effervescent, Anna. Consequently Charlie is overcome with grief and suffers severe depression. As Charlie spirals further and further into depression he slips farther away from reality. The Life Of The Party follows Charlie as he fights with the good and bad voices in his head, represented by two other worldy creatures, Salus and Lues who both have their own agenda and are equally determined to persuade Charlie to follow their path. The story is set in Charlie’s memories, the audience watch as he tries to focus on what is reality and what is imagination. Captured with physical theatre performances and iambic language Charlie fights and contemplates life and the meaning of it all. Is love enough, to help Charlie overcome his demons, you'll have to come and find out. 

The Life Of The Party debuts at The Sydney Fringe Festival this September 9 - 13 at The Erskineville Theatre. 

We desperately need your help to make our dream come true by bringing this play to life. One of the main challenges we face in the world of theatre and film production is the lack of funding from government bodies to grassroots theatre corporations that's why we need your help and any contribution, no matter how small, is a great big help to us in realising our dream. We will be forever grateful for any contribution that you can provide and in return we promise to offer the below perks.

What We Need & What You Get

HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE SPENT:

All funding we receive will go towards theatre and rehearsal venue hire, props, costumes, lighting, staging and technical, marketing material such as the video trailer, DVD, playbills, programs, posters and advertising on relevant theatre and film industry networks.

OUR PERKS FOR YOUR PLEDGE:

$15 - WOW THANKYOU

We know every little bit helps, so thank you for your generosity. For your support we want to thank you with a wonderful prezzie from the cast, a signed Playbill from all involved as well as a shout out on our Facebook and Twitter page.


$25 - GOSH THANK YOU HEAPS!

You will receive a signed Playbill from the cast, big ups and shout outs from the Facebook and Twitter Team. And your name in the Playbill! You will be famous! Your support is so kind and thoughtful we wanna make sure the world knows how amazing you are.


$50 - BY GOLLY GOSH

This means the world to us!

Thankyou so much for your generosity we wanna give you 1 x signed Playbill, Shout out on FB and Twitter, Name in the Playbill and a Copy of the DVD of the performance including highlights like the trailer, cast and crew interviews and your very own poster! 


$100 - WOWSERS TROUSERS

What a wonderful pledge you have just made, you are helping us achieve so much more then you realise. You will receive 1 x signed Playbill, Shout out on FB and Twitter, Name in the Playbill and a Copy of the DVD of the performance including highlights like the trailer, cast and crew interviews and your very own poster! Not only that but you will also get a one of a kind Madd World Production Life of the Party T-shirt to cherish, these are limited edition and we want you to be apart of our troupe so welcome on board friend!


$250 - AWWW SHUCKS YOU'RE MAKING ME BLUSH

You truly are a wonderful person, in helping us through your generosity you will receive all of the above plus a signed cast and crew copy of the script!!

 

$500 - BY ZEUS YOU ARE THE MOST AMAZING PERSON EVER!

Remember all the stuff we said the others received well you will also receive all of that: 1 x signed Playbill, Shout out on FB and Twitter, Name in the Playbill, a signed copy of the Script and a Copy of the DVD of the performance including highlights like the trailer, cast and crew interviews and your very own poster! Not only that but you will also get a one of a kind Madd World Production Life of the Party T shirt to cherish, these are limited edition and we want you to be apart of our troupe so welcome on board friend!

Plus you are invited to a Cast and Crew Dinner (only redeemable by residents of Sydney) where you will meet the cast and crew, ask all the questions you want to know about the production, introduce yourself to the team, get up close and personal with everyone and really become one of the family. This is a night dedicated to those who have pledged an incredible amount and to show thanks we want to give you dinner and drinks on us! The biggest thank you to those who are able to pledge to us and we wanna show you in person.

are able to pledge to us and we wanna show you in person.

story: Our 2015-2016 Season:
story_txt: Our 2015-2016 Season:

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Brianna Adams. I am one of the eight seniors from the University of South Dakota theatre department that was selected to go to the New York City Senior Showcase. The Senior Showcase is an opportunity to go to New York City and attend and participate in workshops, learn from industry professionals working in theatre, and audition for agents, casting directors, and other industry professionals to help us get started in our theatre careers. Many students from the past have made connections and even gotten jobs from this experience. This is a great opportunity for us, but we cannot do it without your help. 

What We Need 

The cost for this trip is quite large which is why we are starting early for this campaign. It breaks down to roughly $1300 per person and there are eight of us. We are applying for a grant that will hopefully bring some of that cost down for us. We also are planning other fundraising events such as cabarets and other performance based projects. The money that we raise will go directly to us, the students. Whatever we come up with will go into our University of South Dakota accounts so that we can use that money to pay for the trip. All of the fundraising money we make will be distributed evenly between the eight of us. Any amount of money that you are willing to donate to us will be extremely helpful and we are grateful for it. 

The Impact

Many of the students that attend the showcase get a great jumpstart to their careers. Some have received representation from agents, and most people get a callback with an agent. This is also a wonderful learning opportunity for us. We will get to participate in a slew of workshops where we will get first-hand experience with working theatre professionals. Kendra Vernon, a 2013 USD musical theatre graduate said of the showcase "Participating in the New York Showcase literally changed the trajectory of my career. Showcase connected me with my current agent, who has been an invaluable resource to me since I moved to New York City." Patrick Beasley, a 2012 USD musical theatre graduate said: "The workshops were an invaluable part of the experience! Receiving feedback, critique, and training from industry professionals gave us great insight on industry standards."

Other Ways You Can Help

The eight of us would like to thank you for taking the time to look at our page and read about what we are doing. We also appreciate that you are helping to support the theatre community as a whole! 

Check out our Twitter @USDNYCShowcase.

Even if you aren't able to donate to our group, help get the word out! Share our IndieGoGo page on your Facebook, Twitter, Instragram, or any other social media outlet you may have! Talk about us on twitter at #USDNYCShowcase.

story:
“The fairy tale is in a perpetual state of becoming and alteration. To keep to one version or one translation alone is to put robin redbreast in a cage.”

―Philip Pullman, Fairy Tales from the Brothers Grimm: A New English Version

“After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world.”

―Philip Pullman

On May 23rd, Blue Spruce Theatre will present  FAERIE TALES, a pair of one-act musicals born in the “Land of Faerie,” directed by Jesse Strachman and starring Teresa Winner Blume and Abigail Clarke. Goblin Market, by Polly Pen and Peggy Harmon, will provide the first “act”, followed by the world premiere of The Rag Doll by Silvia Graziano (book) and David Reiffel (music and lyrics).  The Rag Doll is a new work, conceived and written as a companion piece to Goblin Market.

In 1985, Mel Gussow wrote of Goblin Market, “Whether or not one regards Christina Rossetti's poem ... as a fairy tale for children or a psychosexual plunge into the repressed Victorian heart, there is no denying the forbidden-fruit fascination that it continues to have for the reader - of whatever age, or whichever sex.”

In contrast, The Rag Doll, inspired by the Grimm's Fairy Tale "The Goose Girl at the Spring," employs the contemporary, mundane setting of a tawdry convenience store as the backdrop for enchantment and conjuring.  

Blue Spruce believes that theater is all about connecting with our audience, transforming them in a way they find compelling and poignant. We’ve been doing this from our very first production in 2007, when we offered Jason Robert Brown's The Last 5 Years at the Arsenal Center for the Arts in Watertown, Massachusetts. Beverly Creasey wrote in The Theatre Mirror,  “Blue Spruce Theatre puts down some strong roots with its very first production, the bittersweet chamber musical, The Last 5 Years.”

Inspired by our reviews and success, we’ve gone on to create and produce other high-quality musical works.  In 2010, our production of Once on This Island  (Lynn Ahrens - book, Stephen Flaherty - music) garnered Best Musical Award (BroadwayWorld.com), and Best Director/Best Music Director (IRNE Awards), as well as numerous other awards, nominations, and mentions.

In 2011, Blue Spruce Theatre won Company One’s “Boston Fringe Wars” with The Royal Institute for the Support and Healing of the Arts and Potter's Field Bed and Breakfast, two original musicals written by Silvia Graziano and David Reiffel.

Blue Spruce Theatre is committed to creating engaging, enticing, entertaining musical theater. More than that, Blue Spruce is interested in developing and producing new musical theater works, and we’re one of only a handful of theaters doing that in the northeast.

Like every other professional theater, Blue Spruce pays our artists, rents our rehearsal and performance spaces, and covers our production costs. We offer “Pay What You Want” performances and we are committed to affordable ticket prices throughout our runs.

About a third of our production costs are covered by ticket sales. That’s why we’ve launched this Indiegogo campaign — to meet the remaining costs of making excellent theater while keeping our performances accessible to as many theatergoers as possible. Check out our magical gift categories. From “Kind Stranger” to “Spellweaver,”  “Faerie Princess” to “Ruler of Faerie Land,” all donations are most gratefully received.

Will you join in our mission to make compelling, intimate musical theater for all?

After you’ve watched our video to learn about the exciting things we're doing in FAERIE TALES, please contribute what you can, and please let others know that you’ve become a part of making new musical theater possible in Boston and beyond.

Blue Spruce Theatre was created in September of 2006 in order to bring high-quality, intimate musical theatre to audiences outside of Boston. Our mission is to produce works that connect us to each other as people, and hopefully provide us with a better understanding of who we are, where we came from, and where we are headed.

―Philip Pullman, Fairy Tales from the Brothers Grimm: A New English Version

―Philip Pullman

story:
Our Story

A Very Lupe Xmas is a Live, Theatrical, Holiday Extravaganza brought to you by the award-winning company, Fault Line Theatre.  In the show, a South American immigrant with a heart of gold tries to put on a traditional holiday party, by hiring actors to portray the Wise Men to her Virgin Mary.  When the Wise Men take liberties with the script, and add their own cultural flair, Lupe loses it and fires each and every one of them.  So what happens in Act Two? Can Lupe continue without the Wise Men? Is the holiday season ruined? Or will it be A Very Lupe Xmas after all?  The show is an interactive party where the audiences gets treats (Timbits!), sings along to the Boney M medley, and is asked to help save the show.  We've produced the show on a smaller scale twice before to sold-out audiences, and now we want to make it bigger, bolder and more bawdy! 


The character Lupe has made a big impact in the city of Toronto (even interviewing our former mayor on Youtube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WT6g8KafoFg).  A Very Lupe Xmas is the perfect holiday show: a funny, heartwarming show with a satirical bent; it gets everyone into the spirit of the season.  The show features a diverse cast of Toronto's hottest and funniest actors, and includes music, projections, and a Power Point presentation unlike any other you've seen. 


My Lupe experience was completely delightful. Lupe is a marvelous

creation...infectiously likeable and a clear phenomenon...I was particularly struck by the light

touch of the satire and by the work’s big vulnerable heart.

-Chris Abraham, Artistic Director: Crow’s Theatre


Our Team

Melissa D'Agostino -- Writer/Performer/Co-creator
Adam Lazarus -- Director/Performer/Co-creator

Featuring performers:
Sam Kalilieh
Phil Luzi
Hart Massey


The Impact

Your contribution to A Very Lupe Xmas means we get to compensate the amazing actors and designers who bring their magic to the show, and helps pay for our beautiful venue.  You are also helping us get the show to more people, through our publicity, marketing and outreach. We also give audience members a discount on their ticket if they bring a non-perishable food item for the local food bank -- in this way we can give back to our community in a really tangible way.  And you can help with that! 


What We Need & What You Get

Right now we need $2000 for publicity, $2000 for rehearsal space and several thousand dollars for Insurance and Admin fees.  We also need money for props (edible and not) and photography.  We are reaching out to various sources for funding, and have raised money for our venue and some creative fees already, but your help will be instrumental in bringing this show to audiences by getting the word out and making sure the creative team is adequately compensated.  If we don't raise this money, talented people will not get paid for their time and efforts, and we will be forced to scale back our publicity, and perhaps even the number of shows we do.  Help us bring this fun show to audiences and collect donations for the needy -- we want to raise the spirits of our community! 

What will you get by donating, besides a wonderful feeling of satisfaction and pride? Check out the perks on the right hand side and take advantage of us! We appreciate your support -- let us show you how! 



Other Ways You Can Help

Please let people know about this campaign -- and the show! Post it, Tweet it, Like it, Do it! Your endorsement and word-of-mouth promotion will do wonders for our production -- and we appreciate it! Visit our website and tell everyone you know! 


www.verylupexmas.weebly.com
